The current request will be used for purchasing ingredients for cooking and sale (beef, chicken, rice, potato, and more). The price of these goods varies according to the sales offered by their vendors. This is the third loan America has had with this institution, and she has proven herself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

America es una señora de 46 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de comidas. En su restaurant que se encuentra en su domicilio vende por las noches pollos, hamburguesas y otros tipos de comidas. Su familia esta compuesta por ella, su esposo que es codeudordel crédito, ya no mantienen a sus hijos ya que ellos son grandes e independientes. America tiene una experiencia en el negocio de las comidas de más de seis años, no tiene mucha competencia ya que por la zona hay pocas ventas de comidas. La presente solicitud será utilizada para la compra de insumos alimenticios para su respectiva elaboración y comercialización (carne, pollo, arroz, papa y otros). Los precios de estos insumos varian de acuerdo la oferta de los proveedores. Esta es la tercera solicitud de America con la institución y demostró ser una cliente muy puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food creation and sale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus is a 45-year-old man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally (the taxi), and he rents the microbus. He has a wife and a 20-year-old only son who depend on him.

Jesus has about six years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. This is the fourth loan that Jesus has had with the institution, and in this time, he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual with the payment of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Jesus es un señor de 45 años de edad que se dedica al transporte público en Micro y en Taxi. Actualmente cuenta con dos vehículos que trabajan para el servicio público, una de las movilidades la conduce personalmente (taxi) y el micro lo alquila. Tiene bajo su dependencia a su esposa y su único hijo que tiene 20 años de edad. Jesus tiene una experiencia aproximada de 6 años en el rubro del transporte público, si bien la competencia es bastante elevada en ese negocio, por la cantidad de población la demanda también es elevada. La presente solicitud es para efectuar el mantenimiento correspondiente a su movilidad, ya que es su herramienta de trabajo. Esta es la cuarta solicitud de Jesus con la institución y en este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Maintaining his business vehicles

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Martiza has been a member of the community bank “El Trébol” for one year. She is one of the founding members of her bank. Maritza mentioned that in her community she has learned to be punctual, responsible, how to budget her money effectively, and how to educate her children.

Maritza is 23 years old. She takes care of her two younger brothers who are eight and five years old. Maritza sells beef and pork from a rented stand in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho. She buys live animals at the San Juan market and then butchers them. Maritza works at the market during the weekends and during the week studies elementary education at the local university. During the vacations Maritza works every day.

Maritza needs a loan of 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying meat to sell.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Maritza plans to use her savings to pay for her brother’s education. Her dream is that her younger brothers will finish school and be professionals, to continue to develop her business, to be stable, and to finish her degree.

loans.use: Maritza needs a loan of 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.

loans.name: Eutropia Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for six years. In that time she has learned the importance of saving and is especially appreciative of the interest earning savings account each associate has. Teodosia plans to use her savings to pay her children’s school fees, buy their uniforms, and pay for their supplies.

Teodosia is 36 years old. She is married and has three children who are 16, 12, and 8. Teodosia sells clothing in a small town four hours away from Ayacucho. She buys the clothing in the city of Ayacucho and then sells it at the local market. Teodosia has been doing this for eight years.

Teodosia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy clothing to sell and make some improvements to her house. Teodosia dreams of owning a car and finishing her home.

loans.use: Teodosia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy clothing to sell and make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for four years. In that time she has learned to be responsible and punctual. Lucila was encouraged to join the community bank by her sister and later encouraged her mom to become a member.

Lucila is 33 years old and has four children ranging from 13 years to 18 months. She has a business selling food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar as well as fruits and vegetables. She has owned this business for six years. Before that she rented rooms in her home but ran in to problems when borders often stayed out late and did not pay their rent on time. Lucila needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying more merchandise to sell; such as rice, sugar, and pasta.

Lucila’s dream is to own a big car so that she can transport all of her merchandise.

loans.use: Lucila needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying more merchandise to sell;  such as rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for four years.  She joined the bank after two of her daughters encouraged her to do so.  In that time she has learned how to run her business more efficiently.
Felicitas is 46 years old and has nine children.  She sells clothing in the mall of Vilcashuaman, which was a center in the Inca Empire.  She travels four or five hours once a month to attend her bank meetings.
Felicitas needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more clothing to sell.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has.  Felicitas plans to use her savings to maintain her business.  Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 37 years old, and for the last fifteen years she has worked as a clerk for the FAGASACRUZ business while at the same time developing her work as a merchant. Her husband dedicates himself to offering his gardening services, and on Sunday, they both sell breakfasts at the market in their neighborhood. Cecilia's family consists of her husband and their three dependent children, aged 11, 9 and 3. Due to their experience and the amount of time they've been in business, they have very little competition.

Their present request is for acquiring ingredients for making breakfasts, and for their respective sales. The prices of these goods vary with scarcity in the market and with the season. This is the fourth deal Cecilia has had with Agrocapital, and in that time she has proven herself to be responsible and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una señora de 37 años de edad, trabaja desde hace 15 años como dependiente en la empresa FAGASACRUZ y paralelamente desarrolla sus actividades como comerciante. Su esposo se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como jardinero y ambos venden los días domingos desayunos en la feria de su barrio. La familia de Cecilia está compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años de edad que dependen de ellos. Debido al tiempo de experiencia y antigüedad en su trabajo no cuenta con mucha competencia. La presente soliciutd es para la adquisición de insumos para la elaboración de los desayunos y su respectiva comercialización los días domingos, los precios de estos insumos varian de acuerdo a la escacez de estos en el mercado o bien de la época. Esta es la cuarta operación de Cecilia con Agrocapital y en ese tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Ingredients for breakfast sales

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Auxiliadora Benítez García is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 49 years old and is a single mother of 4 children, all of whom are adults now. For 34 years, she has worked as a seamstress with clients in her neighborhood- employees of offices and universities that prefer her services because of the quality of her work. At the moment, she only has 1 sewing machine and her business is not doing well for this reason. She wants to buy 1 more machine that costs 200 dollars, 10 packages of needles that cost 2 dollars per packet, 9 dozen zippers that cost 1 dollar each and 7 unites of thread that costs 3 dollars per unit.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La Sra. Auxiliadora Benítez García es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. Benítez desde hace 34 años trabaja como costurera teniendo como clientes los habitantes de su barrio, empleados de oficinas y universidades que la prefieren por brindar un servicio de calidad en estos momentos solo tiene una maquina que no esta en buen estado por esta razón quiere comprar 1 maquina que le cuesta $ 200.00 dólares, 10 paquetes de agujas a $ 2.00 dólares cada paquete, 9 docenas de zippers a $ 1.00 dólar la docena de zippers y 7 unidades de hilo a $ 3. 00 dólares cada unidad.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines, 10 packages of needles, 9 dozen zippers and 7 units of thread.

payments.comment: El pago real es de $ 31.25 dólares.
La cuota es de US$ 31.25 Pago las cuotas numero 2 y 3.

loans.name: Magin

texts.es:
Magin is a 45 year odl master mason and also is dedicated to his business of renting land. He works in construction in the city and also rents out some rooms of his house for secondary income. He lives alone with his 16 year old daughter. She is totally dependent on him. He has more than 10 years of experience in his field and does not depend on hiring workers because of the high migration of workers to the exterior part of the country. This is Magin's third operation [loan] from his time with the Institution. In this time, he has demonstrated himself as a very punctual and responsible person.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Magin es un maestro albañil de 45 años de edad, paralelamente se dedica al negocio de los alquileres. Trabaja en diferentes tipos de obras de construcción en la ciudad y también alquila cuartos en su domicilio como segundo medio de ingreso. Vive sólo con su hija de 16 años que depende totalmente de él. Tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia en su actividad como albañil y no cuenta con mucha competencia ya que debido a la migración de mano de obra a paises del exterior, la que queda en el país es bastante cotizada. Actualmente esta operación es la tercera de Magin con la Institución tiempo en que demostró ser una persona muy responsable y puntual.

loans.use: To expand the hosue.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is 23 years old and sells fruit with a walking cart on the road, Epifanio Rios Avenue. Her family is made up of her husband, young child and live in Beatriz's mothers house. After some time of vending, her husband got a job as a taxi driver. They both have significant experience with their respective areas because they have done the same for many years. The fruit business is of good competence because they usually have enough supply to meet the demand and have no problem selling what they have. Also, she offers good deals to her clients by offering good quality fruit. Currently, the cost of a box of apples is BS 140, a box of grapes - BS 120, a box of peaces- BS 140, a bunch of bananas - BS 20.; also she buys apple custard and a percentage of the money earned is used to pay off her car debt. Presently, her credit history is very good. She has always been below the average level of loan delinquency.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Beatriz tiene 23 años de edad y se dedia a la comercialización ambulante de fruta en carretilla y vende sobre la avenida Epifanio Ríos. Su familia está compuesta por ella su esposo y su hijito, actualmente viven en la casa de la mamá de Beatriz. Después de un tiempo de vender en carretilla ahora agarró un puesto, su esposo trabaja como moto-taxista. Ambos tienen bastante experiencia en sus respectivos rubros ya que se desempeñan en los mismos desde hace varios años atrás. La competencia en el rubro de comercialización de fruta es medio, como se trata de un producto de primera necesidad y de bastante demanda generalmente no tiene problema en vender lo que ofrece, además que ofrece un trato muy bueno a sus clientes además de ofrecer calidad en las frutas que vende. La presente solicitud es para la compra de una caja de manzana que cuesta alrededor de Bs. 180.-, una caja de uva que cuesta Bs. 120.-, la caja de durazno que está a Bs. 140.-, el racimo de plátanos que está a Bs. 20.-, también comprará chirimoya que está en su época y por otra parte un porcentaje del dinero utilizará para el pago de una cuota que debe por la compra de un vehículo. La presente solicitud es la tercera de Beatriz y su historial crediticio es muy bueno. Siempre mantuvo un promedio bajo de mora.

loans.use: To buy capital and pay off debt.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang S., 51, rents rooms to the people in her community and makes approximately seven dollars each day. Her husband works as a policeman and earns two dollars per day. They have four children. One of them is employed by a private company and the others are married and live outside the family home.

Mrs. Neang S. is requesting a loan to build more rooms to meet her growing tenant demand.

loans.use: To build more rooms to meet her growing tenant demand

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn S. is 33 years old and married with three school age children. She runs a stand at her home selling coconuts to the people in her community, earning around $1.50 of profit per day. Mrs. Sorn S. is  requesting a loan amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her unemployed husband so he can start a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her unemployed husband to start a motor-taxi business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., 39, is married with six children and lives with her husband in a part of PreyVeng province, Cambodia. She opened her business in 2004 selling provisions of food and other grocery items. She typically earns around three dollars each day. Her husband is a village chief earning three dollars a day and helps his wife when he is available. One of her married sons works as a driver and the rest of the children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Meas S. will use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory and to repair her son’s car.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory and to repair her son’s car.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy T., 40, is married with four children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells porridge every morning to the people in her area making on average $2.50 each day. Her husband works breeding cows on his piece of land.

Mrs. Thy T. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for her husband to use to transport goods and passengers. The balance of the loan will be used to purchase another cow to raise for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and trailer for transporting goods and passengers.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Thy Thear and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng H., 29, is married with one school age child. She and her husband sell a variety of vegetables at a busy market and collectively earn about six dollars in revenue each day.

Mrs. H. has humbly requested a loan to rent another stand at the market to meet customer demand, thus raising her standard of living with the additional income.

loans.use: To rent another market stand to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Meak

texts.en:
Mrs. Meak P., 44, works on her piece of land breeding pigs and typically makes about three dollars each day. Her husband is currently employed by a private company as a truck driver also earning about three dollars per day. They have three school age children. One child is employed at a nearby hospital as a surgeon.

Mrs. P. has requested a loan amount of $1200 to purchase surgical tools for her son to improve his ability to perform his job at the hospital.

loans.use: The purchase of surgical tools for a son to improve his work abilities at a nearby hospital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
Saboat A. is 42 years old. She and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have one child of school age.

For the last 4 years, Saboat has been selling children's clothing in the central local market. Each month, Saboat travels to Bishkek, a city located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to buy children's clothing, and diversify the range of goods of her business. Saboat tries to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Saboat's business is stable and generates a considerable income towards the family's budget.

Saboat became a client of IMON last year. However, even over such a short period of time she has proved to be a reliable client by managing her loans with accuracy. Saboat is now requesting a loan of 900.00 US Dollars to purchase new children's clothing for the summer season of sales. Saboat thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: Purchase of new children's clothing for the summer season of sales

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
Omina N. is 36 years old, and is the loving mother of 4 children. Omina's husband is currently working in Russia.

Omina sells dried fruit, such as apricots in the local market. At the same time she also breeds cattle. She has two cows, one of which is a dairy cow. Omina works hard, as she wants her children to have what they need, and dreams of providing all of her kids with a higher education.

Omina is planning to purchase more dried fruit in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 300.00 US Dollars for a term of 4 months. This is the first loan for Omina and she would like to assure everyone supporting her that she will do her best to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruit for selling

loans.name: Marguba

texts.en:
Marguba Alamuratova is 30 years old, and is married. Her son just started school during the last year.

Marguba has worked the land for the last five years, producing potatoes and carrots. Marguba's husband helps her, and together the family produces the a sufficient harvest for their own consumption and for selling in the market. The business is the main source of income for the family.

In order to improve the business, Marguba needs to purchase seeds for planting, fertilizer, and fuel. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 450.00 US Dollars for a term of 5 months. This is Marguba's first loan and she promises to be prompt in her loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and combustive lubricating materials

loans.name: Bimarhabo

texts.en:
Bimarhabo F. is 38 years old, and she is married with two children of school age.

Bimarhabo sells dried fruit in the central local market. She has been in this business for 6 years. In Tajikistan, people are extremely hospitable, and when there are visitors, most hostesses will serve the traditional bread “lepeshka”, tea, candies, and dried fruit. Bimarhabo tries to have a wide range of goods available and serves her clients with a smile. Her business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family.

Bimarhabo is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase dried fruit, such as raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts. This will increase the range of goods available for sale. Having proved herself to be a reliable client, Bimarhabo promises to pay the current loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruit, such as raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul F. is 39 years old, and he is married with four children.

After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Rasul started a private bakery in his house. He bakes the traditional bread called “lepeshka”. His wife and two elder children help him. He is a hard-working and honest entrepreneur. In his life he has faced difficulties and it was mainly due to the lack of money.

Rasul is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 4 months. The loan will be spent on increasing the working capital and undertaking a major repair of his bakery. Rasul would like to thank all the lenders and IMLF IMON in particular for supporting him during the last three years of his cooperation with IMON.

loans.use: Increase the working capital and repair the bakery

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en: Olimjon N. is 69 years old. In spite of his age, Olimjon still works. He rents irrigated land and plants apricots, which he then sells in the local market. Being very experienced in agriculture, Olimjon also produces wheat. His business is stable and generates the main income for the family.Olimjon is requesting a loan of 150.00 US Dollars for the term of 10 months. He is planning to purchase fertilizer required for producing wheat and apricots. This is the first loan for Olimjon and he would like to thank everyone for supporting and trusting him.

loans.use: Purchase mineral fertilizer required for producing wheat and apricots

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
Rahbar R. is 38 years old, and she and her husband, a taxi driver, have two children.

Rahbar sells children's clothing in the local market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Rahbar's husband is the main bread-winner in the family, however, Rahbar's business also generates a considerable income, which allows the family to improve its living conditions.

Rahbar has been a client of IMON since August 2007, and she has proved to be a reliable and honest client with a positive credit history. She is now requesting a loan of 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase a greater range of goods sale. Rahbar thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase a greater range of children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati is 41, married to D. and has 3 children. For a living she rents her small pool at her house and earns $5 a day. She also sells snacks and instant beverages and earns $1 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch N., 51, is married with six children and works as a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Sor Seam, 53, works as a palm climber collecting palm juice which is finally refined as a palm sugar. With this business’s activity, he can typically make $6.10 each day from selling palm sugar to a busy market. The couple has six children. Two of them work in the factory, each making about five dollars per day; two other children are enrolled in school and the balance of the children are unemployed. Mrs. Touch N. will use this loan to purchase more tools to facilitate her husband’s work and to purchase pigs to raise and resell to the market. ( Her husband is pictured while Mrs. Touch N. is unavailable.)

loans.use: Purchase additional tools for palm sugar refining and pigs to resell at the market.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Oisha

texts.en:
Oisha F. is 54 years old, and she has two children.

Oisha sells peas and various spices and seasoning used for cooking the traditional meals. For instance, one of the spices is called “zira” and is very popular in Tajikistan. It is usually added when cooking “plov”, oriental dumplings, and marinating meat for kebab. Oisha has been in this business for 10 years already. All of these goods are in constant demand by the population, therefore her business is very successful and generates a stable income.

Oisha has been a client of IMON for several years, and for the entire period of time she has proved to be a reliable client and has a positive credit history. Now, she is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Oisha plans to spend the loan on buying peas, haricots, spices, and seasoning for selling. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to be prompt in her loan payments.

loans.use: Purchase peas, haricots, and spices used to cook the traditional European meals, and resell them.

loans.name: Kari

texts.en: Kari, who is 43, is married to A. and has 1 child. To earn income for her family, she sells home made cookies by placing them at some shops nearby, earning $65 a week. She is asking for a loan of $100 to add to her business capital, and, as a member of MBK, she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.en:
Zulaiho J. is 37 years old, is married, and has 5 sons.

Zulaiho works the land, and has been in this business for the last 5 years. She and her husband, who helps her, grow potatoes and carrots. The business is quite stable, allowing Zulaiho to support her large family. The generated income is spent on the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizer, and to pay the salaries of hired seasonal workers.

Zulaiho is requesting a loan of 450.00 US Dollars to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Part of the loan will be spent on improving the living conditions of the family. This is the first loan for Zulaiho and she promises to pay it in time in 5 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming business and improve living conditions.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon C., 49, is married with ten children and works as a housewife cooking food for her large-member family. Her husband, Mr. Koy Keo, 51, works as a trailer driver (a motorcycle attached with a two-wheel trailer to transport goods and passengers) and earns between $7.00-9.00 a day. Two of her children are employed by a garment factory making collectively around $200 per month; three other children work at a construction site. The remaining five children are married and live outside the family home.

This couple will use the loan to purchase another trailer for one of their sons to operate a business and increase the family income. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Suon C. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase another trailer for one of their sons to operate a business in order to keep their income up.

loans.name: Khalima

texts.en: Khalima M. is a 45-year-old married woman in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan and she has 3 children. Mrs. M. has been a MicroInvest client since 2003 and considers herself a very reliable client. She is engaged in the business of selling men’s, women’s, and children's clothes. She has significant (8 years worth of) business experience and, as a result, she has acquired skills that are necessary to succeed in business. Mrs. M. has many loyal customers because she has a wide assortment of goods for sale and because she sells those goods at reasonable prices. Now Mrs. M. seeks a loan of 1100 TJS ($325) to purchase additional goods (specifically, winter jackets).

loans.use: To purchase seasonal goods (winter jackets)

loans.name: Erum

texts.en: Erum is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a small food stuffs store, where she sells a variety of fried snacks and other goods. She earns a total of $20 a day, and her husband works as a public transportation driver. Together, they only earn a small income. Erum is applying for a loan of $125 to increase the inventory of her store, to provide for her children’s education and future. She plans to repay the loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her stall

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
Nozim K. is 30 years old, and is married with three children. Nozim lives with his parents, and is the main bread-winner for his large family.

Nozim sells fruit, such as apples, oranges, and pears, in the central local market. He has been in this business for 11 years. After such a long time, Nozim has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruit to keep their marketable condition and not lose their taste and useful properties. Being located in the biggest central market, Nozim's business has a large clientele and is rather stable, generating the main income to support the family.

Nozim has proved himself to be an honest reliable client. Today he is requesting 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. He plans to use the loan to purchase fruit, such as apples, oranges, and pears in order to increase the range of goods for sale. He would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase fruit in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba S. is 36 years old, and is married with two sons. Unfortunately, her husband is unemployed, so she is the main bread-winner in the family.

Matluba sells sugar in the local market. She and her elder son travel to the neighboring country of Uzbekistan to purchase the sugar. As any mother does, she dreams that her sons can get a higher education, therefore she needs to work hard and to make efficient profits. She does make efficient profits, and her business brings in a considerable income to the family.

Matluba is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 4 months. She plans to increase her working capital, improving her working conditions, and pay the fee for her son's education. Matluba has proved to be a reliable client and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Increase working capital, improve the business, and partially pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Trik

texts.en:
Mrs. Trik H., 48, is a farmer and owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables. She makes approximately three dollars per day. Her husband, Mr. Ang Savon, 47, works in a rice field.. He earns about two dollars each day. This couple has three children. Two of the children work at a factory and have an income of $70.00 a month.

Mrs. H. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.name: Armi

texts.en: Armi, 33, who is married to S., has 3 children. They own a goat livestock near their house. They raise them before selling them, earning, on average, $100 a month. Their income from this business is not regular. Armi is a member of MBK and now she is asking for a loan of $100 to buy more goats to raise. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Odah

texts.en: Odah is 32 and married to H. with 2 children. They run a large vegetable farm where they plant vegetables and legumes. Every month they earn $20 a month with enough market picking and selling the vegetables at the market. Odah is a member of MBK and she is now requesting a loan of $100 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza A. has been a MicroInvest client since 2007. She lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She started her business practically from scratch but now she has her own trade outlet to sell household goods. She trades various products that are daily necessities (haunches, ropes, kettles, clothespins, thermostat phials, etc.) and she has recently expanded her business to sell children's clothes. She has a wide assortment of goods for sale yet she is seeking a loan of 2100 TJS ($625) in order to purchase additional products Chinese suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods from China.

loans.name: Pipin

texts.en: Pipin, 33, who is married to H., has 3 children aged 11, 7 and 1. They have a vegetable farm where they plant corn, radishes, parsnip, etc. and could earn $40 a month. To add to her business capital, she is requesting a loan of $100 and as a member of MBK, she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Herni

texts.en: Herni I., 28, works as a coolie at a construction site and earns a very small income. To earn her living and support her only child, Herni sells clothing such as kid and adult wear, sheets, etc., on credit by going around door to door in the villages. She earns $30 a week. She has joined MBK and now she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam K. is 24 years old. He is not married yet, however, living with his parents he is the main bread-winner for them.

Azam has a minivan and provides transportation services for passengers within the city of Khujand. He has been in this business for 2 years. Initially, he rented the minivan, but over time he saved enough to buy his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main income for Azam’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

Azam needs to purchase spare parts and pay for the repair of the minivan. Therefore, he is requesting 400.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. This is the first loan for Azam and he would like to thank everyone for their trust and promises not to let anyone down.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair minivan

loans.name: Lisnawati

texts.en: Lisnawati is 36 years old, married, and works as a driver for public transportation. She must support her family of two children, and sells cookies and other baked goods in a door-to-door vending service. She would like a loan of $100 to help fund for her children’s education and future, and plans to repay the loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo K. is 48 years old. He and his wife, who is a housekeeper, are raising one child.

Nasrullo provides transportation services. He owns and drives a minivan and works the route between Khujand city and the neighboring city. He has been in this business for 5 years. As he is the main bread-winner in the family, Nasrullo works hard and his business is quite successful, generating a considerable income for his family.

Nasrullo has been provided with several loans by IMON. All of the previous loans have been managed by him accurately without violations. Now Nasrullo needs to purchase certain spare parts and repair the minivan. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Nasrullo promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair the minivan.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
M. Dilbar is 45 years old. She is married with 2 children.

Dilbar is selling the clothing for women in the local central market. Once a week Dilbar travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan for purchasing the new goods for selling. Dilbar is very polite and open person by her nature, and this helps her in the business. For 4 years of her activities she managed to have her clientele. Dilbar ‘s business is stable and brings the main income allowing the family to improve the living conditions and make the plans for future.

Dilbar had demonstrated herself as an honest client managing her previous loans accurately. Today she requests 200.00 US Dollars for the term of 8 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing of new clothing for women with the purpose to increase the range of goods for selling. Dilbar would like to thank everyone for support and to promise to pay the loan in time

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en:
Nuri N. is 49 years old, and is married with three children. Her husband is a pensioner, so Nuri is the main bread-winner in the family.

Nuri sells dried fruits and nuts in the central local market, and has been in this business for 11 years. Dried fruits and nuts are very popular in Tajikistan, and any hostess always has dried fruits and nuts available for serving in case there are guests. Moreover, dried fruits and nuts are, as a rule, served during family occasions such as wedding parties, birthday parties, and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Nuri's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for the family.

Now, Nuri is requesting 875.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase dried fruits like raisins and apricots, and nuts such as almonds and pistachios, in order to increase the range of goods for sale. Nuri has already demonstrated herself as a client with a positive credit history, and she would also like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits like raisins, apricots, and almonds, pistachios in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Susiawati

texts.en: Susiawati, 39, is married to M. and does not work anymore. To support her family needs, she sells household goods such as glasses, clothes, etc. on credit door-to-door around the villages, earning $35 a week with small profit. She is a member of MBK and now asks for a loan of $150 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.en: Mulyati is 37 years old, and married to Z., who has no fixed job. She must earn the stable income for her family. In order to do this, she sells cosmetics such as powder, perfumes, and other beauty products. She operates a door-to-door vending service, and makes a total of $10 a week. She is asking for a loan of $175, and plans to repay in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
T. Baroat is 47 years old, and she has raised two children, both of whom are students now.

Baroat sells women's clothing and handbags. She has been in this business for 23 years. Her trading place is located in the center of the local market, and so she has lots of clients. She tries to have a wide range of goods available to keep her clientele satisfied. The clothing and handbags she buys in the city of Bishkek, located in the neighboring country, Kyrgyzstan. Baroat is the main bread-winner in the family and is working hard in order to generate sufficient income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

Baroat has proved herself to be a reliable client over for the years of cooperation with IMON. Today she is requesting 900.00 US Dollars for the term of 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing women's clothing and handbags in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. Baroat thanks everyonel for their support.

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Kurboniso

texts.en:
S. Kurboniso is 58 years old, and she and her husband have raised two children.

Kurboniso sells men's and women's clothing, and has been in this business for 12 years already. Kurboniso’s trading place is located in one of the markets of the city, and she has a large clientele. She works hard to keep her customers, and to attract new ones. Kurboniso is polite and friendly with clients, and tries to ensure that her customers leave with good purchases and wish to come again. Kurboniso's business is successful and brings a significant income to the family budget, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

Kurboniso has been working with IMON since 2005, and has demonstrated herself as a reliable client. Today she is requesting 1000.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. The loan will be spent on purchasing men's and women's clothing for the spring season for sales. Kurboniso thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase new men's and women's spring clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en: Tuti is currently 32 years old and married. Her husband has no fixed job, and she must support her family by selling plastics. Tuti earns a net profit of $2 a day, and is requesting a loan of $175 to provide tuition for her children. She is planning to repay her loan in a total of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Mursati

texts.en: Mursati, a 51 year old widow whose husband passed away a long time ago. She has to work by herself to support her family and needs to sell cosmetics and snacks door to door, earning $10 a week with very small profit. She is a member of MBK and now is asking for a loan of $175 to add to her business capital so she could earn more income for her family. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Tiira Road D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Angella N.. She is currently in the business of selling dry foods and is requesting a loan to expand her food business. Angella has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 500000 (about $290 USD), to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Angella is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has six children ranging in age from 9 to 20 years and her children go to school. Each week, Angella makes approximately UGX 60000 (~$35 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Angella is joined in her small group by Madina N. and Mirabu W.. Madina N. has a clothing business wants to increase her stock of clothes. Mirabu W. is currently operating a business selling matooke (a plantain banana) and wants a loan to add to her stock.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Mugungu A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Angella M..  She is currently in the hardware business and is requesting a loan to add stock to her hardware shop. Angella is 42 years old and is married. Her husband owns a retail shop. She has 5 children ranging from age 10 to 18, and her children go to school. 

Each week, Angella makes approximately UGX 50000 (about $30 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Angella has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 500000 (about $290 USD), to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time. 

Angella is joined in her small group by Elizabeth A., Harriet N., Grace K., and Sylvia W..  Elizabeth A. has a business selling dry cassava and wants to add to her business.  Harriet N. sells dry maize and wants a loan to purchase more maize from villages.  Grace K. operates a business selling dry maize and wants to add to her maize business. Sylvia W. currently sells dry cassava and is requesting a loan to expand her cassava business.

loans.use: Add in the business and increase stock in hardware shop.

loans.name: Eli Haryati

texts.en: Eli is 47 years old, and married. Her husband is currently unemployed, and to support her family, Eli sells a variety of foods and other supplies. Eli earns a total profit of $1 a day . She joined MBK and is now requesting a total loan of $125 to expand her current business. She plans to repay her loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tiira Road H Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Grace N.. She is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Grace is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is an engineer. She has 5 children ranging from ages 6 to 14, and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 50000 (~ $30 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Hajara N. and Jane N.. Hajara N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to add to her charcoal business with the loan. Jane N. also sells charcoal and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To add to fish business

loans.name: Tiira Road E Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jennifer N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Jennifer is 37 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children ranging from age 6 months to 15 years, and five of the children go to school. Each week, Jennifer makes approximately UGX 150000 (~ $87 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Jennifer has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Jennifer is joined in her small group by Irene N. and Annet N.. Irene N. has a business selling ripe bananas and wants to add to her banana business. Annet N. also sells ripe bananas and wants a loan to increase her stock of bananas.

loans.use: To expand fish business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en: Muazzam K. lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 3 children. She has been a MicroInvest client since 2004 and has received business development loans that allowed her to expand her business in such a way that she could open her own trade outlet for children's clothing. Mrs. K. receives her goods from bulk suppliers which permits her to sell her products at prices that are lower than in the bazaar. She has a wide assortment of children's wear for newborns and adolescents (sport suits, jackets, dresses, etc). Now Mrs. K. seeks a loan of 1500 TJS ($450) to purchase additional products (specifically, warm slacks and trousers).

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing (warm slacks and trousers)

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab H. is a businesswoman. She is 38 and married with 5 children, who all live together. Her business is to sell food. Zainab's plan is to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Abdulajon

texts.en: Abdulajon B. has been a MicroInvest client since 2004 and he firmly believes in MicroInvest's lending procedure with respect to business development loans. Mr. B. is married and has 5 children. He was not able to receive much of an education, but he truly hopes that his children can receive a good education so he is prepared to work extremely hard to make that happen. He is engaged in the family business of livestock raising and selling. His wife helps him with milk production and in making milk-sour products so that they can supply such products to local trade outlets. In addition, he is a talented wood-worker and gardener. Now Mr. B. seeks a loan of 3500 TJS ($1,025) to purchase additional livestock.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
I am Khalida J. M., group leader. Nazira B., Khalida B., Shumaila B. and Tahira B. are my group members. We all have been together for about a year and have learned to be punctual, responsible and keen to enhance our families' financial outlook.

I have lived all my life in Chichawatni, a small city in Pakistan. I have six kids. My eldest son has completed tenth grade and now wants to start a betel nut shop. One of my daughters is married and one son is working at a factory. All of my other kids attend a local school. I am borrowing a loan for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institution. This loan will help my son start a betel nut shop in a nearby market. He has promised to give me a decent portion of his income daily, which will help me save money for the repayment of your loan and cook better for my family.

Khalida B. stitches clothes and wants to start a sewing school where she will teach our community girls how to stitch. Nazira B.‘s husband is a tailor. Shumaila B.’s husband is a cobbler and wants to buy some material required for repairing shoes. Tahira B. is borrowing for her husband who wants to start a barber shop.

If you lend I assure you that we all are mutually responsible for each other’s loans.

loans.use: Start a betel nut shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kumushoy

texts.en: Kumushoy T. lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 3 children. Mrs. T. has been a MicroInvest client since 2004. She first applied to MicroInvest when her business was struggling and needed financial support to better develop the business. At present, she has her own trade outlet where she sells a wide assortment of perfumes and beauty supplies (hair dyes/tints, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents, etc.) at reasonable prices. Now Mrs. T. seeks a loan of 1200 TJS ($350) to purchase additional goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Sarfraz's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sarfraz A.. I have been living with my family in a small town, Chichawatni, for the last 20 years, since my marriage. I have seven kids: five daughters and two sons. All of my younger kids attend school, while the older ones have completed elementary school and are working. My husband runs a small motorcycle workshop and also sells spare auto parts. Last year, we took out a loan, which my husband used to buy spare parts for his shop. With this investment our business grew better, and profits almost doubled. With this significant increase in income we were able to marry one of our daughters in a very dignified manner. For this year, my husband again plans to buy spare parts in a larger quantity and needs a loan for this purpose.

I am a group leader of a few other women who are also in need of loans. Abida B. plans to use this loan to improve her family's fruits business. Basheera B.’s husband is a builder and wants to buy a few construction supplies. Zainab B. is borrowing to expand her family’s vegetables business. Akberi B. will invest the loan in her son’s used-items trading. We have been together for one year and help each other in both family and business matters.

loans.use: Buy spare auto parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en: Mahsat J. is 47 years old, she lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 6 children. Her family has experienced financial problems, so does her best to improve her family's well-being. Therefore, she works extremely hard and trades her goods (beauty supplies and perfumes such as hair dyes/tints, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents, etc.) near the flea bazaar. Now Mrs. J. seeks a loan of 1100 TJS ($325) to purchase additional goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en: J. Mahsat was born in 1961 in the J.Rasulov region and she is married and has 6 children. Despite the difficult financial terms of the family she tries to do all her best to improve the prevalent situation. She works hardly and trades nearby the flea bazaar by the perfumery (hair dye/tint, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents and etc). Now Mrs. J. Mahsat requests the loan of 1100 STJ for the new good purchasing.

loans.use: for the new good purchasing

loans.name: Mwanahawise's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawise R., age 38, is married with 2 children (18 and 21 years old). Mwanahawise owns a wholesale soft drinks business, which she started 4 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 8 PM daily, she earns about $170 a month from this business.

Mwanahawise has successfully taken out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to purchase more soft-drink inventory. Mwanahawise belongs to a loan group called Tushirikiane and will be sharing this loan with member Mwanalauisi. Mwanalauisi has businesses in food vending and carpentry.

loans.use: To buy soft-drink inventory for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en: Zulkhumor A. has been a MicroInvest client since 2005. She applies to MicroInvest for business development loans that help her to support and expand her business. She is engaged in the commercial services industry where she makes Xerox copies and computer service presentations for her customers. Now Mrs. A. seeks a loan of 3700 TJS ($1,075) to purchase additional office equipment (specifically, the new model computer and a scanner).

loans.use: To purchase new office equipment (computer and scanner)

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en: Ashura J. is 25 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children. They live together as a family. Ashura is a food vendor, and her plan for the loan is to develop her business.

loans.use: To develop her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema S., age 38, is married with 1 child (who is 19 years old). Rehema owns a shop selling alcohol, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 6 PM daily, she earns about $65 a month from this business.

Rehema has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy alcohol stock for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Rehema belongs to a loan group called Garden.

loans.use: To buy more beer and other beverages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.en:
G. Abdunaim is 36 years old, and he is married with four children.

Abdunaim is a cattleman, and has been in this business since childhood, when he used to help his father. As he had been trained by his father, after he had served in the army, he purchased cattle for raising. Currently, he has 1 cow with calf and 1 bull. The business is quite stable and generates the main income for the family.

Now, Abdunaim is planning to purchase one more bull. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 875.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Abdunaim and he promises not to let down those who have trusted and supported him.

loans.use: Purchase one bull for raising and then selling.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en: I am married and a mother of seven. I live with my family in the small town of Chichawatni , Pakistan. I am a health worker and provide health services to the women of my town. This is a small town and there are not many health facilities. I operate from my house, and now I want to buy a few medicines and other items for my business. This is a group loan. My loan members are all entrepreneurial women. Nasreen B. will use the share of her loan to improve her family's business of supplying various bakery products to different shops in the city. Shazia B.’s husband runs a medical pharmacy and wants to improve it. We all are mutually responsible to repay your loan without any delays.

loans.use: Buy medicines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ridhik

texts.en:
Ridhik S., age 35, owns a wholesale soft drinks business, which she started 3 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 5 PM daily, she earns about $45 a month from this business.

Ridhik has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy soft-drink stock for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Ridhik belongs to a loan group called Baraka, which means “blessing” in Swahili.

loans.use: To buy more soft-drink inventory for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marach D A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hadijah W.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Hadijah is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Hadijah makes approximately UGX 60000 (~ $35 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Hadijah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Hadijah is joined in her small group by Farida M. and Issa R.. Farida M. has a restaurant and wants to purchase more raw food and a refrigerator with the loan. Issa R. is currently operating a business selling rice and wants a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To add to a clothing business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba S. is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children. Her family all lives together. Her business is to sell small food items, tea snacks, and cold drinks. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elivira

texts.en:
Elivira N., age 35, owns a carpentry business, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 7 PM daily, she earns about $90 a month from this business.

Elivira has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more wood for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Elivira belongs to a loan group called Bondeni, whose members make sure that everyone pays back her loans.

loans.use: To buy more timber

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
I am Balqees J., and I belong to the Christian community of Chichawatni, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two sons. My elder son studies in grade two and my younger son is in kindergarten. My husband operates a betel nut shop in a nearby market. He needs to buy a few items for his shop and does not possess enough money to purchase them. Kindly give us a loan for a twelve-month period. I am borrowing in a group of few other women: Shahnaz G. wants to expand her pharmacy. Naseem S.’s husband wants to start a bicycle rental store. Nabeela B. operates a grocery store within her house. Basheeran B. is also borrowing for her family’s business.

All of us reside very close together and are mutually responsible for this loan. If one does not repay, the others will pay for her.

loans.use: Buy a stock of items for betel nut shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kireka A1(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Beatrice M.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of shoes. Ms. M. is 30 years old and single. She has 2 children aged 10 and 16 and her children go to school. Each week, M. makes approximately UGX 60000 (~ $35 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Ms. M. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Ms. M. is joined in her small group by Joan Nakigudde, Grace M., Florence N., and Beatrirce Z.. Joan Nakigudde has a business selling clothes and wants to add to her clothing business. Grace M. operates a gift shop and wants a loan to add to her stock. Florence N. operates a business sellng shoes and wants to expand her business. Beatrirce Z. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of shoes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema K., age 39, owns a roadside café that she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 4 PM daily, she earns about $55 a month from this business.

Rehema has successfully taken out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy food stock for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Rehema belongs to a loan group called Nyota.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food items for her café

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kireka A2(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Irene N.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke (plantain bananas) and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Irene is 30 years old and is married. Her husband works for the Pepsi Company. She has 4 children ranging from ages 2 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 100000 (~ $58 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build rental rooms.

Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 500000 (~ $291 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Jawuhala Nakibule, Robinah N., Mary N., and Aisya N.. All of the group members operate businesses selling matooke and want the loan to add in their businesses, to increase stock, and to expand them.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke (plantain bananas) to sell

loans.name: Witness's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Witness S., age 36, is single and owns a small general store, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 5 PM daily, she earns about $65 a month from this business.

In the past, Witness successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy inventory for her business. She now hopes for a loan to once again purchase shop inventory. Witness belongs to a loan group called Upendo and will be sharing this loan with group members Easther H., Rhoda S., and Frida A.. These women have businesses dealing in hardware, clothing, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
S. Lola is 34 years old. She is the loving mother of 4 adorable girls, the elder is 14 and the younger is only 2 years old.

Lola and her husband live together with her husband’s parents. In order to help her husband support the large family, they started their own business. For the last 8 years, Lola has sold curtains. She has her own trading place in one of the local markets. Being a very friendly and polite person by nature, Lola obtained her clientele very quickly. The business is stable, and generates the main income for the family.

Now, Lola is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business. She needs additional funds to purchase new curtains to sell. With this purpose in mind, Lola is requesting 950.00 US Dollars. She has received loans from IMON several times, and has proved to be a reliable client. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: Increase working capital and expand business through purchase of new goods to sell.

loans.name: Kireka A2(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jane N.. She has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her shop. Jane is 38 years old and is divorced. She has one daughter, age 12, who goes to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 30000 (~ $17 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up another retail shop.

Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 1000000 (~ $582 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Melisha J., Malusi N., and Happy Z.. Hadijah N. has a cosmetics shop and wants to add to her stock and buy more mirrors. Melisha J. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to increase her stock. Malusi N. sells clothing and wants to add to her clothing business. Happy Z. has a tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock in a retail shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura A., age 37, is married with 2 children (12 and 10 years old). Ashura owns a small bookstore, which she started 3 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 7 PM daily, she earns about $90 a month from this business.

In the past, Ashura successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to purchase books to sell for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Ashura belongs to a loan group called Nyota.

loans.use: To buy more books for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kireka A2(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Annet M.. She has a bar and pub business, and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer and drinks. Annet is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children ranging in age from 11 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.

Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 1000000 (~ $583 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

 Annet is joined in her small group by Suzan M., Aminah N., Nelly N., and Shakira N..  Suzan M. has a beauty salon and wants to buy more weaves and braids. Aminah N. has a beauty salon and wants a loan to buy a hair dryer. Nelly N. operates a poultry farming busines and wants to purchase more poultry feed. Shakira N. sells cold soft drinks and is requesting a loan to buy another refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha B., age 30, is single and owns a small general store, which she started 3 years ago. She earns about $90 a month from this business.

In the past, Asha successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to purchase shop inventory for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Asha belongs to a loan group called Molemo.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kireka A2(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Fiona N.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of shoes. Fiona is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 2 children, ages 5 and 7, both of whom go to school. Each week, Fiona makes approximately UGX 50000 (~ $30 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Fiona has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Fiona is joined in her small group by Fatumah A., Margret N., Mary N., and Dorothy K.. Fatumah A. has a local brewery and wants to add to her brewery business. Margret N. sells roasted maize and wants a loan to buy more maize from the village to increase her stock. Mary N. operates a furniture shop and wants to expand her business. Dorothy K. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes and expand her business

loans.name: Kireka A2 (V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase the stock in her shop. Margret is 39 years old and a widow. She has 3 children ranging in age from 12 to18, and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 20000 (~ $12 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 300000 (~ $175 USD), to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

loans.name: Damisson

texts.pt:
Damisson Absalão S., 28, was born in the neighborhood of Boane, in Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives with his young son and three sisters in his mother's house. A teacher at an elementary school in Boane Sede, Damisson has been working toward a college degree in Education/Pedagogy since 2005. In 2006, with money saved from his job as a teacher, he bought a piece of land, with the goal of eventually building his own house. Per a friend's suggestion, he joined the Hluvuku-Adsema credit program in 2007. Now on his third loan cycle, having paid his first two loans in full, Damisson will use the amount of $525 to buy more materials, so he can finally start building his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao :Bairro 7 Cliente : Damisson Absalão S. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo:12.000,00 MT ( 508 USD) Aplicação: Compra de Materiais de Construção Data Inicio: 28-01-08 Data Fim: 21-07-09 Damisson Absalão S., de 28 anos de idade e pai de um filho, nasceu no distrito de Boane. Província de Maputo. Tem 4 irmãos dos quais três são meninas. Filho de pais separados e estando ele a viver com sua mãe . Começou a estudar na escola primaria de Boane . Depois passou pra a escola secundaria Joaquim Alberto Chissano para fazer o nível básico, não havendo o segundo ciclo no distrito seguiu para Escola secundaria da Matola para fazer o segundo ciclo do ensino secundário. No ano seguinte começou a trabalhar como professor na escola primaria de Boane Sede . Em 2005 engrena na faculdade pedagógica para se formar na área de ciências pedagógicas estando ainda a frequentar o curso. Em 2006 comprou seu terreno com seu próprio fundo, e tendo dificuldades de ter valor para compra de material de construçao para começar com a sua obra comenta com um dos seus colegas de trabalho sobre a deficuldade e ele aconselha-o a procurrar um Banco sendo este nosso cliente fala-lhe da Hluvuku-Adsema e aproximou-se pra saber dos requisitos e mete seu primeiro pedido de empréstimo no valor de 8.000,00MT tendo pago sem nenhum problema. Depois deste mete segundo pedido no valor de 12.000,00MT que já foi aprovado na sua totalidade. Tem como maior sonho ter sua própria casa.

loans.use: To buy construction material to build his house

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
Matilde Norbeto M. was born on June 26, 1958 in the Chitevel district in Boane. She is 50 years old, widow with 7 children. She was raised in Boane and attended school until the 3rd grade. She met her husband in 1978, because of the war they had to seek refugee in the neighborhood 3 of Guegege in Boane.

Matilde joined the Gueguegue credit program but did not continue because they only offered group loans and borrowers had to take responsibility for the group. She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema by a neighbor. With her first loan she bought a refrigerator. With the loan of 20.000mt to increase the volume of her business. She is looking into getting a store of her own. With the income from the business she supports her children and pays for their schooling. Her business has a positive impact in the neighborhood because it brings the products closer to people, in the future she wants to buy a b bigger refrigerator and open a fish business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao:Bairro 3 Gueguegue Cliente: Matilde Norberto M. Actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00MT ( 847.00 USd) Aplicação :compra e venda de produtos da 1ªnecessidade Inicio 05-02-08 Fim 29-07-09

Matilde Norbeto M. ,nasceu aos 26 de Junho de 1958 em Chitevel distrito de Boane,tem actualmente 50 anos de idade viúva com 7 filhos ,viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais em Chitevel-Boane . Frequentou a escola até 3ªclasse . Conheceu o seu marido em 1978 e como não tinha alternativa de emprego dedicava-se na êDevido a guerra de desestabilização tiveram que abandonar a casa e refugiar-se no bairro 3 Gueguegue em Boane Depois da morte do marido passou-se já a se dedicar muito no comercio para a sobrivivência . Teve o seu 1º contacto de empréstimo com associação Gueguegue localizada no bairro do mesmo nome que ofereciam créditos em grupos ,não tendo sido uma boa experiência de credito porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham que assumir a responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos elementos do grupo não efectuasse o pagamento . Conhece a Hluvuku-Adsema, através da vizinha e dai aproximou e solicitou o seu 1ºemprestimo para compra de congelador ,Com este empréstimo de 20.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio ,adquirindo mais mercadoria.

Actualmente esta explorando um pequeno estabelecimento próprio ,mas sendo o único no local que oferece um bom ambiente do negocio,com os rendimentos do mesmo suporta as despesas da escola e de saúde dos seus filhos O seu negocio tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque coloca o produto mais perto do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos da deslocação dos clientes . Ela dirige pessoalmente o seu negocio e na ausência a filha é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo. Futuramente pretende comprar mais um congelador maior, para abrir outro tipo de negocio (venda de peixe).

loans.use: To buy stock to increase the business

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando Rodrigo C. is 31 years old. He has 3 children. He was born in the district of Chokwe in the Gaza province. He has 6 brothers and 3 sisters. Armando lives with his parents. His family moved to Boane when Armando was 3 months old. He attended primary and secondary school there. Later, he studied at IMAP to become a teacher. In 2001 he returned to Boane to work in a primary school in Mahubo. In 2006, he was transferred to the Fish School in Boane.

In 2002, he was married and moved. Later he returned to Boane and decided to continue his father’s business, which had been abandoned. He saved money to buy a lot in the neighborhood 6. Later he tried to buy construction material. He spoke with his father about where to get funds and was directed to Hluvuku-Adsema.

Armando is requesting a loan of 25.000mt. His dream is to build a home for his family and move from his father’s house. He also wants to grow hiss business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao :Bairro 6 Boane, Maputo. Cliente : Armando Rodrigo C. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo:25.000,00 MT (1.059.00 USS) Aplicação: compra de Materiais de Construção Data Inicio: 05-02-08 Data Fim: 30-05-09

Armando Rodrigo C., de 31 anos de idade e pai de tres filhos, nasceu no distrito de Chokwe. Província de Gaza. Tem 9 irmãos dos quais três são meninas. Filho de pais casados ainda vivos, estando a viver com eles. No seu terceiro mês de idade vem a boane. Começa a estudar na escola primaria de boane sede e o ensino secundário do primeiro ciclo na escola secundaria Joaquim Alberto Chissano. Depois segue pra IMAP de Chibututuine no Distrito da Manhica pra fazer o curso de professores. Em 2001 volta a boane pra começar a trabalhar tendo ele sido escalado na escola primaria de Mahubo onde trabalhou ate 2005. em2006 é transferido pra escola primaria do Fish em Boane.

Começa a viver maritalmente em 2002 estando a viver na casa do serviço e depois volta a Boane pra casa dos seus pais. Na sua estadia em Mahubo alem de dar aulas realizava uma actividade comercial. Na sua vinda a boane resolve ocupar o estabelecimento comercial do pai que estava parado sem gerar nenhum rendimento. Durante algum tempo desenvolvendo a actividade foi juntando alguns valores monetários pra compra de um terreno no bairro 6. dfepois da compra tentou comprar alguns materiais de construcao não estando a consiguir conversa com seu pai a pedir opinião de como devia proseguir pra construir a construir a sua casa, este aconselhou le a aproximar-se a Hluvuku-Adsema pra fazer empréstimo pra pagar pouco a pouco e mensal. Assim sendo aproxima-se pra saber dos requisitos pra aceder o credito e decide meter seu pedido no valor de 25.000,00MT estando por ser financiado.

Tem como seu maior sonho ter sua casa feita pra estar com seus fihlos no seu próprio teto e não estar sub tutela de seu pai, e sua actividade comercial a caminhar na melhor maneira possível.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house
