loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Esteria K. is 27 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 5,7 and 10. She has two other dependents, who are her brothers in-law. In 1997, Esteria established a crops business. Esteria now requests a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase crops in bulk

texts.pt:
Alberto A. M. was born in the Boane, a province in Maputo in 1980. He is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and his brothers. He attended night school until the 9th grade, but because of the violence in the neighborhood he stopped going. He married when he was 25, he has a 4 month old son.

He started working providing construction material to the Education ministry. Today he has a business in the Agrarian Investigation Institute in Boane. He is also building another business in Boane block 2. Alberto’s business employs 2 people. Alberto has been working for the government for 1 year and 8 months as an agricultural technician. He was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by friends. His first loan was of 10.000mt. Alberto is requesting a loan of 25.000mt to finance his business. For him this credit is direct way to grow his business. In the future he plans to build a home of his own.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 7 Cliente: Alberto A. M. Actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 16.000,00mt ( 677 USD ) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção para venda Inicio:28-01-08 Fim: 22-05-09 Alberto A. M. , nasceu em Boane Província de Maputo em 1980, tem actualmente 27 anos de idade . Vive ate então num ambiente familiar com os pais e os irmãos mas numa casa própria, Estudou ate a 9ª classe, devido muita violência na vila de Boane viu se com necessidade de ter que parar de ir a escola. Pôs frequentava o curso nocturno. Aos 25 anos de idade casou se e tem, actualmente, um filho de 4 meses. Começou esta actividade ha muito tempo fornecendo material de construção ao Ministério de Educação. Actualmente tem o seu estabelecimento no “INSTITUTO DE INVESTIGACAO AGRARIA de Boane , Mas esta a construir um outro estabelecimento na zona de Bloco 2 em Boane e conta com 2 empregados. Ė Funcionário Publico ha 1ano e 8 meses, com categoria de técnico de agricultura.

Já trabalhou numa instituição de crédito na zona de Dlhanguene na cidade de Maputo. Conhece a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA durante uma conversa com alguns amigos tendo aproximado e solicitado um credito no valor de 10.000,00MT para o comércio. Desta vez solicita outro empréstimo no valor de 25.000,00Mt Para ele, o credito é a forma correcta e directa de dinamizar desenvolvimento. Tem como perspectivas de ter uma casa condigna fora do recinto da casa dos pais.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. Aidah is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 13, and her children go to school. Each week, Aidah makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to start a bar business. loans.name: Magret

texts.pt:
Magrete Maria B. was born in the Namaacha district of Maputo province on July 27, 1979. She is now 28 years old. She has 5 brothers and sisters. She studied until 8th grade, and due to circumstances, stopped studying early. She married at the early age of 17, and had her first child at the age of 18. She now has two children.

She started her business when she was still living with her parents, because the business helped support her family. Her first experience with credit was with HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, which she became aware of through her sister-in-law. She approached HLUVUKU and requested a loan of 20,000 MT for her business. She repaid the loan without difficulty.

With the loan of 30,000 MT, she plans to buy chicks and feed, which are acquired in the city of Maputo, 35 km from the capital. The growth period for the chicks varies from 35-45 days, after which they are placed in the local market for sale, creating a positive impact for Magrete's family and the community, which is supplied with meat locally at accessible prices.

Her future plan is to have an increasing loan size, in order to be able to keep growing her business more and more.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer.

Localização : Bairro 07
Cliente: Magrete Maria Bande
Actividade: Comercio
Valor de empréstimo: 30.000,00 MT ( 1.200 USD )
Aplicação: Compra de pintos e Ração
Inicio: 31-01-08
Fim: 25-05-09

Magrete Maria Bande, nasceu na Província de Maputo Distrito de Namaacha ao 27 de Julho de 1979, tem actualmente 28 anos de idade. Tem 5 irmãos legitimos. Estudou ate a 8ª classe e devido a falta de condições deixou de estudar cedo e, consequentemente, teve um casamento precoce tendo casado maritalmente com 17 anos de idade. Teve o seu primeiro filho com 18 anos e actualmente tem 2 filhos. Começou a praticar o comercio quando estava ainda a viver com os seu pais ,porque sustentavam a família com o comercio. O seu primeiro contacto com o credito fui com a HLUVUKU- ADSEMA. Conhece a HLUVUKU graças a sua cunhada, dai aproximou se e pediu um credito no valor de 20.000,00 para o comercio, tendo pago o credito sem dificuldades. Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00MT pretende comprar pintos e racao, que sao adquiridos na cidade de Maputo que dista 35 Kms da capital. O periodo de crescimento dos pintos varia entre 35-45 dias, depois do qual sao colocados no mercado local para venda, criando um impacto positivo para a familia da Magrete e na comunidade que abastece-se de carne localmente a precos acessiveis. A sua perspectiva futura e ter um credito cada vez maior de modo a fazer crescer o seu cada vez mais o negocio.

loans.use: To increase her business ( to buy chickens for retail and to buy feed)

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Sophia M. is 47 years old. She is married and has six children, who are between the ages of 15 and 26.  She has two other dependents, who are her grandchildren. In 2002, Sophia established a grocery business. Sophia now requires a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator and stocks of beer and soft drinks. 

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing.
Sophia's bar is a good place to get a beer for those who manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where one can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand.  The aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’  (kebabs made on an open fire) wafts around and there is good conversation.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and stocks of beer and soft drinks

texts.en: Saodat K. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 3 children. She started the business practically from scratch but now she has her own trade outlet to sell household goods. She trades different wares that are necessary in daily life (haunches, ropes, kettles, clothespins, thermostat phials, anionic detergent, etc.). Now Mrs. Saodat K. seeks a loan of 2200 TJS ($650) to purchase new household wares from China.

loans.name: Domingos Francisco

texts.pt:
Domingos T. Xavier, born in Matola in 1933, was raised by his parents, who sent him to seminary in 1950. He is a pastor and father of fifteen children.

In 1956 he began to work for CFM (Mozambique Ports and Railways) until 1990, at the height of its reform. Since then he has dedicated himself to his business and to raising ducks for sale.

He learned to know HLUVUKU through an employee, through whom he approached and asked for his first credit in 2007.

With the proceedings from his business, he plans to support his dependents and provide for his family's education.

With this loan he plans to increase the volume of merchandise, and buy more ducks to raise and resell.

In the future, he plans to set up a gas pump to supply the neighborhood of Chinonanquila.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localização: Bairro Chinonanquila, Boane

Cliente : Domingos T. Xavier

Actividade: Comercio

Montante:15.000,00mt ( 628 USD )

Aplicação : Compra de produtos para a revenda

Inicio: 28-01-08

Fim: 22-05-09

Domingos T. Xavier, nasceu em 1933 na Matola, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais os quais o encaminharam ao seminário em 1950 e é pastor e pai de 15 filhos.

Em 1956 começou a trabalhar nos CFM ate 1990 altura da sua reforma. Desde então dedica se a negocio de mercadoria e criação de patos para a revenda.

Conhece a HLUVUKU através de uma funcionaria da mesma dai que aproximou se e pediu o seu primeiro credito em 2007.

Com os rendimentos do negocio aumenta o volume da mercadoria na sua, suporta os encargos familiares, educação da sua família e amplia a sua obra.

Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria e comprar mais patos para criar e revender.

Como perspectiva do futuro pretende montar uma bomba de petróleo para fornecer ao bairro de Chinonanquila.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Anna M. is 46 years od. She is married and has four children who are between the ages of 18 and 25. She also has two other dependents, who were street children. In 2006, Anna established a business of curing red palm seeds. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase a curing machine.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase a curing machine

loans.name: Isabel Novo Mariamo

texts.pt:
Isabel Novo Mariamo M. was born in 1940 and was raised by her parents. She didn't study beyond third grade due to her early marriage. She is a widow and mother of eight children. Since her childhood, she has dedicated herself to subsistence farming. With the death of her husband in 2002, she saw she would also have to pursue a small business. She started with a little stall in front of her home, and later in the Josina Machel market at milepost 16, without giving up her stall at home.

She learned about Hluvuku through an employee in 2006. She approached them and solicited her first loan the same year, to grow her business. Her business has hit a good stride, despite having paused for more than a month recently after the death of her daughter, a victim of a longterm illness.

With the profits of her business, she supports her family dependents, school fees of her five grandchildren, as well as the health of the whole family. With the loan of 11000 meticais, she intends to acquire more merchandise so as to avoid being out of stock.

Her business has a major impact on the community, as it places basic necessities closer to residents of Chinonanquila, as well as provides employment to herself as a widow, and to one of her grandchildren, who runs the stall at home.

Her plan is to buy the booth at the market at milepost 16 and reconstruct it with conventional material.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localizaçao: Mercado Josina Machel km 16, Boane.

Nome: Isabel Novo Mariamo M.

Actividade: comercio

Montante: 11.000.00mt

Aplicação: compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade

Inicio: 28-01-08

Fim: 22-05-09

Isabel Novo Mariamo M., nasceu em 1940, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais, não estudou para alem da 3ª classe devido ao casamento precoce, viúva, e mãe de 8 filhos. Desde a sua juventude dedicou-se a agricultura de subsistência.Com a morte do seu marido em2002 viu-se obrigada a dedicar-se também a pequenos negócios, começou por uma pequena banca em frente a sua residencia e mais tarde no mercado Josina Machel no km16 sem com isso ter abandonado a banca de casa.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma funcionaria da mesma instituição em 2006, aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º credito no mesmo ano para a ampliação do seu negocio. O seu negocio esta num bom ritmo, pese o facto de ter tido uma pausa de mais de um mês apos a morte da sua filha vitima de doença prolongada, recentemente.

Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares dos seus 5 netos, assim como as de saúde de toda a familia. Com o empréstimo de 11.000.00MT pretende adquirir mais mercadoria de forma a evitar ruptura de stock.

A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade, pois põe o produto de 1ª necessidade mais próximo dos residentes de Chinonanquila para alem de proporcionar emprego, a ela que e viúva, e, a um dos seus netos que cuida da banca de casa.

A sua perspectiva e comprar a banca do mercado km16 ao município e reconstruí-la com material convencional.

loans.use: To buy stock to improve the business

Her husband, Mr. Choun Lay, 47, sells deep fried ducks in the market earning five dollars a day. They have two children. loans.name: Tully

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Tully M. is 28 years old. She is not married but has three children, who are ages 4,7 and 10. In 2003, Tully established a local restaurant business. Tully has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to buy more kitchen utensil and food to sell. 

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils and food to sell

loans.name: Edirisa

texts.en: Edirisa is 62 years old and married with 11 children and takes care of 8 grandchildren. For 42 years, he has been buying hides and skins from Uganda Meat Packers which he sells to various suppliers and exporters in Kawempe, Busega. He also buys land and houses and develops them before selling them at a higher price. He also has a welding workshop at Kireka near his home where he makes metallic doors, windows, and gates. He is our client and according to him, if it were not for his daughter’s assistance, he would have problems particularly with paper work and advice. He accords his success to his forefathers who trained him in business as he has trained his daughter. He intends to invest the loan more into his businesses.

loans.use: To buy more hides, skins, and land to boost his income.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Lucy S. is 29 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 3,7 and 13. She also has three other dependents, who are her stepchildren. In 2000, Lucy established a tailoring business. Lucy has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to buy more cloth to make dresses.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to buy more cloth

loans.name: Bukaye B North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saniya K.. She is currently in the business of selling timber and is requesting a loan to boost business. Saniya is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 12 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and two of them go to school. Each week, Saniya makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater to home expenditures. Saniya has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to start a timber business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Saniya is joined in her small group by Jamila N., Aziza M., Alayisa K., and Mariamu N.. Jamila N. has a business in trading millet flour and produce and wants to expand the flour business. Aziza M. is currently operating a business in clothes vending and wants a loan to uplift it and also start a poultry business. Alayisa K. operates a business of cattle trading and a butcher shop and wants to increase the number of animals traded. Mariamu N. is currently in the local restaurant and retail shop business and is requesting a loan to increase stock in her shop.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of timbre traded

loans.name: Busei A South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of cattle and poultry and is requesting a loan to buy another cow for business. Hasifa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man dealing in cattle and poultry for work. She has 10 children ranging from age 5 months to 14 years and her children go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy poultry chicks, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Madina M., Deborah M., Mariam B., and Fatuma W.. Madina M. has a poultry business and wants to buy more chicks. Deborah M. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to trade more cloth materials. Mariam B. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to start selling new clothes. Fatuma W. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to trade a bigger variety of produce.

loans.use: To buy another cow and expand poultry business

loans.name: Ntenjeru Tubeere Bumu Group

texts.en: Being a businessman has helped Zeblon, the chairperson, succeed. The 54 year old resident of Ntenjeru in Kayunga district is a farmer who raises cassava, maize and banana on his 3 acre plantation. He is married with 12 children of which 1 is at Kyambogo University, 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school while 6 are out doing their own businesses. He has been in business for six years and the loans have helped him on his plantation, especially with paying manpower.  He has gotten high quality yields that generate enough income to buy sacks of charcoal from far away villages for sale at a profit. And this being a rainy season, the price of charcoal is high to his advantage. He intends to buy more bags of charcoal with this loan. He is so committed and hard working and all members agree that the previous loans have helped them rise from the rugs.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and pay manpower on his plantations.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has a small stand where she sells books, newspapers and magazines at an outdoor market in Noviy Rosdil, Ukraine. As someone who loves to read, this is an ideal business for Galina. She has been in operation for eleven years and currently has a good location at the market for her kiosk. Galina is married and has two children, a fourteen-year -old son and a twelve-year-old daughter.

Galina has requested a loan of $900 to help her purchase a new supply of popular books and magazines to sell. She hopes to continue the success of her business and use her profits to pay off some bills. Eventually she also would like to expand her business by opening a new sales location at a different market.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Semukombe Development Group

texts.en: N. Mary, the chairperson of Semukombe Development Group, located in Buwama off Masaka road, is 46 years old and married with 9 children.  She also cares for three grand children. She is a farmer with banana and coffee plantations on their three acre farm.  She also raises goats, cattle, pigs and chicken for sale. The group has been in existence for 8 months and it’s doing great.  This is mostly because they are committed, focused, together, and God fearing; in fact they have a Reverend father in the group. Mary does not depend on only her plantations, at times she goes around buying produce which she theb sells to her customers for a profit. She intends to buy more goats and pigs with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats and pigs and employ more workers on her plantations.

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid has a small enterprise which allows him to combine his love of cars and driving with business. He travels around to small villages in the Zaporoshye Oblast in central Ukraine and operates a vending business where he sells a variety of small items such as tools, small parts, school supplies and office supplies. Leonid got into this type of business recognizing that the retail industry in many small villages was underdeveloped and he could meet a need. He is good about determining what items will be in demand depending on the season and adjusts his inventory accordingly. Leonid’s wife also helps him with the business. They have two grown children.

Leonid has requested a loan to add to his working capital before the upcoming season change. The loan will allow him to be prepared with new inventory for the spring season and also help ensure that his car is in good working order. Leonid is a jolly, honest entrepreneur. We are happy for this opportunity to help him maintain a successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche E. F. is single, 23 years old, and lives in Benin City. He deals in the sales of weaves. He has been in business since 2006. This is a business he learned for 6 years. He solicits a loan of $675 to enable him to buy more weaves to sell. He is a LAPO client. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weaves for sale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a single mother who supports herself and her daughter with a small clothing sales business. Svetlana originally started her business from her home but has now been able to move into a little space at an indoor mall in Novaya Kahovka. She has been in business for about three years. Her monthly profit is typically between $400 and $1000.

Svetlana has requested a six month loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory to sell. A conscientious, well educated entrepreneur, she asked detailed questions about our organization before taking her first loan. She is pleased with the financial services available to her and we look forward to many more opportunities to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has a successful business selling high quality clothing and leather wear at a market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. In business for eleven years, she is a very experienced entrepreneur. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Tatyana is married and has two daughters. Her business is an important source of income for their family. Tatyana has benefited from her relationship with Nadiya Ukraine. Not only has it helped her financially, but it has also made a difference in her life spiritually. Through working with our organization, she has been able to grow personally by realizing how much she needed the Lord and to be in church.

Tatyana has requested a loan of $500 to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Chidi

texts.en: Chidi O. is 31 years old, single and lives in Benin City. He has been a LAPO member for 2 years. He sells cosmetics and has been in this business since 1997. This is a business he learned for 8 years. He needs the loan amount of $1200 to enable him to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins M. is 26 years old, single and lives in Benin City. He has been a LAPO client for 2 years, and solicits a loan of $850 to enable him to buy more cosmetics and weaves for sale. He has been in business since 2006.

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Enea M.. She is single with one child aged 7. In 2006 Enea established a stationery business. Enea has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase inventory in bulk. 

The foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management, never ceases to amaze me. Stationary sales is a business where such wisdom is demonstrated, with most sellers strategically placing their shops, stalls, or tables strategically near to post offices, banks, schools and universities.

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit-worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

texts.en: Chibike I. specializes in the sales of cosmetics and weaves. According to him, if the loan amount of $600 is given to him, it will go a long way to buy more cosmetics and improve his business. He is 27 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He learned this business for 6 years and started in 2005. He has been with LAPO for 2 years and he thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Zainabu S.. She is married with no children. In 2006 Zainabu established a second hand clothes business. Zainabu now requires a loan in order to purchase inventory in bulk. 

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit-worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

texts.en: Katebo business group is located in the Katebo trading centre in Buwama. The chairperson, N. Juliet is 52 years old, divorced with 9 children and cares for 6 grandchildren. This loan will help her employ local workers and buy more pigs since they do not take long to mature. This will in turn help her continue paying fees for her school going children.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew O. is 27 years old and single with 2 children. He lives in Benin City and has a workshop that he uses for his lubricating work. He solicits a loan of $600 to enable him to buy drum oil and wheel alignment materials, and to renovate his workshop to meet the standard of the customers. He has been with LAPO for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy drum oil and  alignment materials

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Neema M.. She is married with three children, aged 1, 3 and 6. In 2004 Neema established a charcoal business. Neema now requires a loan in order to purchase inventory in bulk. 

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit-worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Rehema N., age 38, is married with 4 children (ages18, 16, 15, and 12). She has a poultry business which she began 4 years ago. She opens her business from 9am to 5pm daily, making a monthly profit of around $43.3.

In the past, Rehema took out 1 previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy suit materials for sell from door to door and to increase on poultry business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase on the same business. She will share this loan with her sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling foods, clothes and livestock.

In the picture, Rehema 1st on the right

loans.use: to increase on business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Eliza M.. She is married with three children, aged 2, 5 and 9. In 2004 Eliza established a retail store. Eliza now requires a new loan in order to purchase inventory  in bulk. 

 
About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  For women with low incomes, there are few economic opportunities and poor access to basic needs and services 

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie G. is 50 years old and has 5 children. She is married and lives in Benin City. She has been in business for 28 years. She sells bread. She needs the loan amount of $850 to enable her buy more bread for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero G. is 50 years old, married and has 8 children. She sells cooked food and has been in business for 28 years. She has been a LAPO member for 9 years. She needs the loan of $850 to buy more food items and drinks, and for renovating her business venue. She is a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy food items and more drinks for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: The young entrepreneur K. Joseph is a fisherman and it’s through fishing that he is what he is today. He is 29 years old, married with 5 children and has four of his late brother’s children in his care. He owns two boats that operate at the Katebo landing site off Masaka road as well as other fishing materials like fishing nets.  At times he fishes himself and this earns him a lot while at other times, especially when he needs a rest, he employs other fishermen on his boats. His customers are fish retailers from surrounding towns as well as tourists. He requests a loan to enable him sell more fish now that their prices are high.

loans.use: To sell more fish and pay school fees for his children now that the school term has began.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is a mother of 9 children, 49 years old and married. She sells cooked food and drinks; she learned this business for 3 months and started hers in 2005. She solicits a loan of $525 to buy more food items and drinks to sell. She is thanking Kiva in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy food items and more drinks for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is married with 5 children and is 50 years old. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuff, a trade she learned from her mother. She has been in LAPO for 8 years and she is the leader of her group. She needs a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions, drinks and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Cécile Fifonsi

texts.fr:
Miss Cécile Fifonsi M. was born on September 8, 1985 in COTONOU in the LITTORAL area in southern BENIN. She is single and has no children and sells household soaps, biscuits, sardines and other items in MISSEBO (a market in DANTOKPA). She is a very moral person and and her clientele grows from day to day. She needs this credit to meet the increasing needs of her customers and to answer the competition.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Cécile Fifonsi M. est née le 08 septembre 1985 à COTONOU dans le Département du LITTORAL au Sud du BENIN. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et vend au détail des savons de marseille, des biscuits, des sardines et autres à MISSEBO (marché connexe à DANTOKPA). Elle a une bonne moralité et fait partie de celles de nos clients dont la clientèle s’accroît au jour le jour. Elle a donc besoin de ce crédit pour faire face à la croissante demande de sa clientèle et aussi pour répondre à la concurrence.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 cartons of BF et FANICO soap

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Jamadah

texts.en: M. Jamadah, 68 years old, is married with 15 children and 7 grand children. His business is growing rice and sugar cane on his 3 acre piece of land. For the rice, he gets free seedlings from Kawanda in Entebbe who come and buy the produce once it’s ready while he sells the remainder for local consumption. He grows sugarcane for sale and home consumption.  He was the best in his locality and the ministry of agriculture paid him a visit recently. He needs a loan for employing manpower for better quality yields. He believes he can do better.

loans.use: To employ people to work on his rice farm to increase on the quantity and quality of produce

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience Ikponmwosa is 61 years old and mother of 9 children. She is married and sells provisions and firewood. She has been in her business for 31 years and needs a loan of $175 to buy more provisions and firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and firewood for sale

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly I. is a mother of 8 children and married. She is 42 years old. She has been a LAPO client for 8 years and is the secretary of her group. She sells moimoi to the people in her community and she has been in the business for 8 years, and learned it for 3 years as a caterer. She seeks a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more beans, groundnut oil and other ingredients for the preparation of moimoi for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet U. is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells drinks and provisions; she has been in LAPO for 8 years and has been involved with her business for 13 years. She needs the loan of $850 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: L. Stephen is a fisherman who has been fishing ever since he was young. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. Stephen uses his small timber boat for fishing, and it has proved to be a challenge, considering the amount of fish he usually catches (on average, 30 to 40 a day). Stephen has been a client of the loan organization for over two and a half years, and is now asking for a loan to be able to buy a much bigger boat and more fishing nets.

loans.use: Purchase of a large boat and nets for fishing

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella I. is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She has been a LAPO member for 6 years and trades soup ingredients, a business she has been in since 1974. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more soup ingredients for sale.

loans.use: To buy more soup ingredients for sale

loans.name: Munilaty

texts.en: Munilaty A. has been a hairdresser for 6 years.  She is married and supports 2 children.  Munilaty is requesting $525 to purchase hair creams and hair extensions to meet the her customers' demands.  She hopes this loan will increase her income so she can better provide for her family.  Munilaty is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase hair cream and hair extensions.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She sells women's clothes, shoes & bags to workers in offices and banks. She started her own sales store in 1993. She is a LAPO client and is requesting a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more clothes, bags and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes, shoes & bags for sale

loans.name: N . Carole

texts.fr:
Born on August 11, 1982 in Cotonou in the LITTORAL area in south BENIN, Carole E. is single and has no children. She sells alcoholic beverages in DANTOKPA (international market of BENIN). A very moral person, she is very passionate about her business and is concerned about its survival and growth. The introduction to the Beninese market of new beers such as ZLATOPRAMEN and VAN PUR has made it necessary for her to ask for this loan in order to renew her stock as well as attract new customers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 11 Août 1982 à Cotonou dans le Département du LITTORAL au sud BENIN, Carole E. est célibataire sans enfant. Elle vend des boissons à DANTOKPA (marché international du BENIN). De très bonne moralité,elle a de la passion pour son activité et le souci de l'évolution de cette dernière. L'introduction sur le marché béninois de nouvelles bières telles que ZLATOPRAMEN, VAN PUR l'a contraint à solliciter ce prêt à la fois pour renouveler son stock que pour attirer de nouveaux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 25 cases of canned beer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: George

texts.en: K. George is a 62 year-old businessman. He is married and has 11 children and 4 grand-children. George is the owner of Katebo New Life Club and Lodge in Katebo trading center. At the Club, he sells beer, soda, and Ugandan local food to the locals and fishermen who appreciate it especially after a hard day’s work. In addition, George offers accommodation to those fishermen that have late-night fishing shifts. The Club and the Lodge are located right next to his house. Currently, George needs a loan to help him renovate the premises in order to attract even tourists. Specifically, he plans to use the loan money to buy wall paints and new furniture.

loans.use: Purchase of wall paints, beddings, and chairs for a club

loans.name: Busei A South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of cattle and poultry and is requesting a loan to buy another cow for business. Hasifa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man dealing in cattle and poultry for work. She has 10 children ranging from age 5 months to 14 years and her children go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy poultry chicks, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Madina M., Deborah M., Mariam B., and Fatuma W.. Madina M. has a poultry business and wants to buy more chicks. Deborah M. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to trade more cloth materials. Mariam B. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to start selling new clothes. Fatuma W. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to trade a bigger variety of produce.

loans.use: To add in poultry business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Vera

She has been in business in since 2005. She is a LAPO client, and needs a loan of $850 to buy more cassava for the production of Akpu, as well as general provisions for sale.

She needs a loan of $850 to purchase an additional dryer and rent a bigger store in order to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Almedina

texts.en: Almedina was born in 1989, and she is from Visoko. She is not married, and she lives with her family. She has two brothers and one sister. This is her first loan. She intends to use this loan, in the amount of 1,200 KM, for purchasing the clothes that she will sell at the market. loans.name: Busei A South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Alice B..  She is currently in the business of farming and selling silver fish, and is requesting a loan to start trading big fish like nile perch and tilapia.  Alice is 34 years old and is married with a husband works as a builder.  She has 5 children ranging from age 8 to 15, and her children go to school.  Each week, Alice makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to bank the money and save it for future use.  Alice has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to uplift her poultry and fish trading business, and the loan was paid back on time.  

Alice is joined in her small group by Hadija N., Zida N., B. Zaituni, and Aidah S..  Hadija N. has a business in selling sweet potatoes and wants to expand to trade a variety of produce.  Zida N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase fixed assets in the shop.  B. Zaituni operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to rent another permanent place for business.  Aidah S. is currently in the grocery business and is requesting a loan to set up a bigger stall.

The group leader of this small group is Nuru Z.. She is currently in the retail shop business and is requesting a loan to increase stock in the shop. Nuru is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a farmer. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 12, and her children go to school. Each week, Nuru makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to bank the money and save it.

Nuru is joined in her small group by Zainabu N., Fida K. and Sania K.. Zainabu N. has a business in tailoring and wants to uplift the business. loans.name: Mededji N.

texts.fr:
Born in 1959 in ADJOHOUN in the PLATEAU area, Mrs. Mededji N. L. has lived for more than 20 years in AVOTROU, one of the popular districts of COTONOU, characterized by a highly dense population. She is married to a man in his sixties and is a mother of 5 children of whom she still takes care. From a hangar in her house, she sells various condiments and beans, which her customers appreciate. In spite of her age, she is devoted to her business, and is determed and courageous. Mrs. Mededji N. L. is asking for this loan in order to meet the expectations of her clients.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1959 à ADJOHOUN dans le département du PLATEAU, dame Mededji N. L. réside depuis plus de 20 ans à AVOTROU l'un des quartiers populaires de COTONOU caractérisé par une forte densité de population. Elle est mariée à un sexagénaire et est mère de 05 enfants qui sont à sa charge. Elle vend sous un hangar de la cour de sa maison divers condiments et du haricot que ses clients apprécient bien. Malgré son âge avancé, elle se consacre à ses activités avec détermination et bravour. Dame Mededji N. L. sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.name: Igamba East A Group

The group leader of this small group is Irene K..  She is currently in the business of trading new clothes and is requesting a loan to get a permanent place for business.  Irene is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man.  She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 11 and her children go to school. Madina Namukose is currently in the business of retail shop and waragi brewing and is requesting a loan to buy more drums and straws for brewing waragi. loans.name: Hamidu

A. Hamidu is a trader who buys slippers and sells to her costumers. Hamidu is married and has 1 child. She wishes to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $225 to enable her to buy more slippers for sale.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
My group members’ perseverance and desire to succeed in life are the reasons which compel them to improve their existing businesses. I am their group leader because all of them feel that I have leadership qualities. All of us reside in Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its handicrafts.

I embroider clothes, while my husband is a painter, and he paints buildings and houses on order. I have five kids: three girls and two boys. Three of my kids are under 15, while the others are older. I am requesting a loan for my own business and for the others. Below is a small description of my group members’ businesses.

Suriya B. plans to use her share of the loan in her family’s cotton business. Nadia B.’s husband manufactures bolt-nuts used in machines. Amna B. sells fabric and wants to buy a suitable quantity of merchandise.

This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans.

loans.name: Osasogie

texts.en: Osasogie O. is a seamstress by profession. She is 36 years old, and is married with 4 children. She has been in business for 3 years and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $425 to diversify her income. She would like to buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks, and buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for selling drinks, and also buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She is a stylist and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2006. She needs a loan of $425 to buy a refrigerator for selling cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for selling cold drinks

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is a very successful hairdresser.  She is married and has 1 child.  Felicia runs a local hairdressing salon and currently has 8 employees working for her.  In addition to her hair salon, Felicia also sells women’s clothing and bags.  Felicia is requesting $525 to improve her hairdressing salon, pay employees, and buy jeans and bags for sale.  Felicia is the group leader of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To improve her hairdressing salon, pay employees, and buy bags for sale.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina was born in 1981, and she lives in Gornja Lukavica, the Živinice municipality. She is married, and her husband works in a furniture factory. They have two children, 8 and 3 years old. The older son goes to primary school. This is her second loan at MCO WWI, and she is going to buy a calf. She plans to fatten the calf, then resell its milk products to earn extra money for the household.

loans.use: Buying a calf

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo Aghiaruwa is 52 years old, married with 6 children. She sells household items, like mortar and pestles, for pounding. She is from Edo, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $275 to buy mortar and pestles and grinding stones to sell.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience Enogieru sells provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. She was born in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2007. She needs a loan of $275 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is a 22-year-old, single mother of 2.  She has been a trader for 3 years and works extremely hard to support her children.  Esther currently doesn’t have a business stand so she sells her cooking supplies by walking through residential areas and local markets to find customers.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional bowls, cooking utensils and pots. Esther is also a member of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional bowls, cooking utensils, and pots.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Mr. Sergio A. lives in his rental in the area of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz with his son. Mr. A. is retired from public administration, but currently works as a driver of public transportation. Because of landslides that occurred ten years ago, he lost his house and the municipal government awarded him a plot of land in the Cotahuma area, where he undertook the construction of a two floor structure for housing. The loan he is requesting is for the construction of three rooms on the ground floor. This is the sixth time that he is applying for a loan and the credit analysis on him qualifies him positively for this loan amount.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Sergio A. vive en alquiler en la zona Obispo Bosque de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hijo; el señor Alabama es rentista (jubilado) de la administración pública, y actualmente trabaja como chofer de transporte publico. A causa de deslizamientos ocurridos hace diez años, perdió su vivienda y el gobierno municipal le adjudicó un terreno en la zona de Cotahuma en la que realizó la construcción de estructura para una vivienda en dos niveles. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de tres habitaciones en planta baja. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: For the construction of three rooms. (Construcción de tres habitaciones)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas I. is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She sells meat. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables for sale and establish a business location

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old. She sells clothes and jewelries, and is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $675 to buy more clothes for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose I. is 39 years old, and is married with four children. She sells beef (meat) for sale. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for a year. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more  beef  for sale.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Blesing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with 6 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 50 years old, and has been in business for 3 years. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more birds (some for laying eggs) for rearing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for rearing

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina O. is 40 years old. She is married and has 7 children. She sells provisions and baby things. She is from Edo State, and has been in business since 2000. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more provisions and baby things for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and baby things for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is married with 6 children. She is 46 years old and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuff. She has been in business since 2000. She learnt her trade for a year. She needs the loan amountof $875 to buy foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is married with 6 children. She is 46 years old and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells food, and has been in business since 2000. She learned her trade a year ago. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more food to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is 46 years old. She is married with five children. She owns a restaurant. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2004. She needs a loan amount of $425 to buy more chairs and also drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and drinks for my restaurant

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi B. lives in Nikopol and runs a business selling hats and caps at the central city market. His vending facility has a very favorable location. Dmytryi has been in this trade for 4 years. Throughout these years his business has remained stable, and been strengthened by Dmytryi’s integrity and thorough approach to every detail. Currently, he has about $4,000 worth of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $500.

Dmytryi is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his inventory and earnings. One of his long-term plans is to expand his business and purchase a small vending facility that would work as a store to sell hats. Dmytryi has previously benefited from the lending services provided by “Nadiya Ukraine” and has established a reputation for honesty as he has worked with our organization. We believe this loan will provide further assistance to Dmytryi as he seeks to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Increase inventory for his clothing stall

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a widow living in Pavlograd with her daughter and grandson. Tamara runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the local market named “Yulana”. She retired from another job not long ago and felt like she needed to keep busy with something that would help her earn an income. Tamara has been involved in this trade for 14 years. She recently moved her vending facility to a different location which has promoted an increase in her sales. Tamara has many loyal customers. She is very friendly and amiable with each client, thus giving her a unique talent of attracting new customers.

Tamara purchases clothing wholesale every week. Usually she spends about $600 each time. Tamara is hoping to use the loan of $1,000 to purchase 20 women’s suits this time. She hopes to see her venture grow big enough to afford to buy a new vending facility in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 20 women’s suits

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is single. He lives in Pavlograd and owns a small business selling women’s and men’s clothing in two different local markets – “Yulana” and “Novyi”. His inventory is of good quality and in high demand among customers. Vladimir has been in this trade for 4 years. Presently, his turnover capital is about $1,6000. His weekly net profit is about $200-400.

Vladimir’s business is his only source of income. After he quit his job in coal mining because of a low salary, he decided to start his own venture. This is how he became an entrepreneur selling men’s outerwear. Starting in the beginning of 2007, Vladimir expanded his inventory range and started selling women’s clothing as well. One of his main goals is to buy a small store and open a new vending outlet. Vladimir is requesting a loan of $1,000 to invest in expanding his business. A portion of his generated profit will be used to plan his wedding, set to happen this summer.

loans.use: To purchase a facility for a new store

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with 4 children. She is 38 years old and is from Edo state, Nigeria. . She sells clothes and baby wears. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan $425 to buy more products for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby products for re-sale

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth U. is 41 years old. She is married with five children. She is from Edo state, Nigeria. She sells baby products and cosmetics. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more baby products and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.use: To buy more baby products and clothing for sale

loans.name: Mercy Itohan

texts.en: Mercy I G. is married with 3 children. She is 47 years old and sells drinks and bread. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001. She needs a loan of $675 to buy more bread and drinks for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther Ogbewe is 69 years old. She is married with eight children and originates from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells farm produce and other foodstuffs. She has been in business since 1988. She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more yam seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy more yams seedling for planting

loans.name: Haryati

texts.en: Haryati, 33, is married to D. who has no fixed job. To provide for her family needs, she sells cosmetics such as powder, parfume, face cleanser, etc., door to door, earning $4 a day. She is a member of MBK and now requesting a loan of $75 to buy more good to sell. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell in her cosmetics business

loans.name: Nina Widawati

texts.en: Nina, 37,  is married to M. J. who has lost his job. To support her family she sells flavoured ice and fruits at her food stall near her house, earning $10 a week with a very small profit. She has joined MBK and now is requesting a loan of $150 to buy more supplies for her food stall. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more supplies

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani, 48, is married to J. who has lost his job. To earn income for her family she opened a small shop infront of her house where she sells vegetables, snacks, instant noodles, etc., earning $10 a day with $1 worth of profit a day. She has joined MBK and requesting a loan of $150 to buy more goods for her shop. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida, 31, is married to S. who has no fixed job which means they don’t have a regular income. To cover the family needs, she raises ducks and sells them, earning $5 with $3 worth of profit every quarter. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $100 to buy more ducks so she could earn more income for the family. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Siti Nuriyah

texts.en: Siti, 52, is married to D. who does not have a regular income to support his family. Siti has to work hard to cover the family needs by selling clothing on credit, door-to-door such as sheets, blanket, etc., earning $20 a week with a small profit. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of $125 to buy more goods to sell. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods

loans.name: Esperanza Maria

texts.es:
Seeing the need to support her family five years ago, Esperanza decided to open a grocery store in her neighborhood. She is a hard-working woman, however, she says, without the help of EDAPROSPO she would have been unable to start her business. Little by little, she has been buying the necessary furniture for her store. And, today it is quite a store, stocked with products where she and her two children help manage it. Esperanza's dream is to have a bigger store, so that some day she could leave it to her two grandchildren, who live with her as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Viéndose en la necesidad de solventar a su familia, hace cinco años, Esperanza pensó abrir un puesto de abarrotes en su barrio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, sin embargo, ella afirma, sin la ayuda de EDAPROSPO no hubiera podido iniciar su negocio. Poco a poco con el paso del tiempo, ella ha ido comprando los muebles necesarios para su bodega. Hoy luce una tienda muy surtida de productos en donde ella y sus dos menores hijos ayudan a manejarla. El sueño de Esperanza es poder tener una tienda más grande para que algún día ella pueda heredarla a sus dos nietos que viven con ella también.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store, and to grow her business. (Agrandar su actual tienda de abarrotes e inaugurar uno nuevo.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung, 41, is married to S. and they both sell toys such as balls, cars, etc..  They do this door-to-door on his bicyle. Doing this, they can earn upto $7 a day. To add to their capital they are asking for a loan of $75 and as a member of MBK, Enung agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, 31 years-old, runs a business to be admired. Without doubt, her commitment is something she has inherited from her parents, who have similar jobs. Thanks to them, she obtained a grocery stall in the market eight years ago. Nonetheless, the strength which the work involved, carrying heavy merchandise, meant that her spine suffered due to the strain, as she was the only one running the stall.

Five years ago, having recovered, she decided to resume her work. Looking after her home and educating her two children, 11 and 2 years-old, did not stand in her way. Now, with the help of her partner, she sells sweets on the same market stall.

With funding, Lucy would open another stall in the market and resume her grocery business because, compared with selling sweets, it offers greater financial gain.

Translated by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

A sus 31 años Lucy maneja un negocio admirable. Ese empeño lo heredo sin duda de sus padres, quienes también atienden un oficio similar. Gracias a ellos, ella obtuvo un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado hace ocho años. No obstante, la fuerza que demandaba el trabajo de cargar mercadería pesada hizo que su columna vertebral sufra los daños de su gran esfuerzo, ya que ella era la única que se encargaba de su puesto. Hace cinco años, al recuperarse de su mal estado, decidió continuar. La necesidad de mantener su hogar y educar a sus dos hijos de once y dos años, no la harían desistir. Ahora, con la ayuda de su pareja, vende dulces en el mismo puesto del mercado. De tener la oportunidad de recibir un financiamiento, Lucy abriría otro puesto en el mercado y empezaría de nuevo con su negocio de abarrotes; porque, a comparación de su actual negocio de dulces, es el que más ingresos brinda.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, 34, is married to S. who no longer works. To support the family, she sells flavoured ice and fried snacks at her food stall infront of her house, earning $8 a day with a very small profit. To expand her business she is requesting a loan of $100 and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
From a young age, Guadalupe has worked in order to help support the family’s income. Now, at 53 years old, married with three children, she continues to work with the same effort and commitment. When she moved to her current home two years ago, she realised there were numerous factories and manufacturing companies in the vicinity. Furthermore, she learned there was no restaurant nearby. With her creativity, she decided to make breakfasts and mid-morning snacks for the service staff working within the local businesses. Lacking space to serve her customers, she took food to their workplaces. Guadalupe says that there are periods in which her business is not making a profit. And so, a year ago, she decided that, as well as selling food, she would also sell leather handbags and wallets which she makes herself. She did all this with the aim of putting her youngest daughter, 20 years old, through university. Her dream is to finish constructing a room where she can serve her customers and also sell her products (handbags, wallets, pullovers etc).

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde su infancia, Guadalupe esta acostumbrada a trabajar por la necesidad de ayudar en la economía de su familia. Ahora a sus 53 años, ya casada y con tres hijos ella continúa trabajando con las mismas fuerzas y empeño. Cuando se mudo hace doce años a su actual vivienda, ella detectó que había muchas fábricas y empresas manufactureras alrededor de su casa y además, ningún restaurante cerca de ellas. Con su ingenio decidió preparar desayunos y almuerzos para el personal de servicio que trabajaban en ellas. A falta de un espacio donde atender a sus clientes ella lleva la comida al mismo lugar de trabajo de sus clientes. Guadalupe cuenta que hay temporadas en el que su negocio no sale a cuenta. Por ello decidió hace un año que, además de vender comida también vendería carteras y billeteras de cuero hechas por ella misma. Todo ello con el objetivo de ver terminados los estudios universitarios de su menor hija de veinte años. El sueño de ella es terminar de construir una habitación donde poder atender a sus clientes y también vender sus productos (carteras, billeteras, chalecos, etc).

loans.use: To complete construction of an area for her restaurant and shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mintarsih

texts.en: Mintarsih is a 43 year old widow whose husband has passed away several years ago leaving her working by herself to support her family. She sells rambutan fruit infront of her house, earning $5 a day with a very small profit. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of $125 to buy more fruits and expand her business. She has agreed to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more fruits

loans.name: Roheti

texts.en: Roheti is a 50 year old widow whose husband passed away a few years ago, leaving her working by herself to support herself.  Everyday she goes around villages, door-to-door, carrying her bamboo basket to sell vegetables, earning $10 a day. She is requesting for a loan of $100 to add to her business capital so she can buy more vegetables to sell and earn more income for her family. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Realizing that her first business, a small grocery store, was not profitable for her and her 3 year old son, Esperanza decided to work in a textile factory with the little knowledge she had about sewing. While she worked there, she aquired a lot of experience and knowledge on textiles thanks to the constant training they provided. When the factory had a staff reduction, she was let go. However, she didn't allow herself to feel upset about the situation, instead she felt sufficiently trained and empowered to begin her own sewing business. Esperanza, with her only extra possession - a sewing machine, began to sew clothing for some of her family members and friends. Today, she sews clothing due to the many requests from her clients, which she is thankful she does not lack. Her goal within a few years is to run her own garment workshop, where she will work along with her youngest daughter and her nieces. To this end, she needs a variety of sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

A raíz de que su primer negocio, una pequeña bodega, no era rentable para ella y su pequeño hijo de 3 años, Esperanza decidió trabajar en una empresa textil con sus pocos conocimientos sobre costura. Durante el tiempo que ella laburo en este empresa adquirió mucha experiencia y conocimientos sobre el tema textil gracias a la constante capacitación que obtuvo. Luego de una reducción de personal en su trabajo ella fue despedida. Sin embargo, ella no se dejo abatir por ello y se sintió lo suficientemente capacitada y segura para emprender su propio negocio de costura. Es así que, Esperanza con lo único que tenía extra -su única maquina de coser- empezó a confeccionar ropa para algunos familiares y amigos. Hoy en día, hace ropa según los pedidos de diversos clientes, que felizmente no le faltan. Su objetivo dentro de unos pocos años es implantar un taller de confección donde trabajaría ella, su hija menor y también sus sobrinas. Para esto, ella requiere diversas maquinarias de costura.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of sewing machines so that she can start her sewing workshop.  (Comprar maquinarias de costura para implantar  un taller de confeccion.)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes' first job was selling bread in small baskets on the street. Since there was more to lose than gain, given the dangers of loitering in the area and the thefts which she eventually suffered there, she decided to change business. Whilst learning how to look after her her home and then eventually moving house, she decided to open a small business, preparing and selling breakfasts from home. Nowadays, she serves breakfasts and sometimes mid-morning snacks if the customers ask for them. At 63 years old, she is still as enthusiastic about her business as when she first started. Together with her daughter-in-law, she wants to expand her restaurant. Her long term aim is to be able to reorganize it. However, what she longs for the most is to buy shelves where she can display her dishes and drinks and also buy new tables and chairs for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El primer trabajo de la señora Mercedes era vender pan en canastilla en la calle. Puesto que veía más pérdidas que ganancias, a causa del peligro que rondaba en la zona y los robos que sufría eventualmente ahí, optó por cambiar de oficio. En la búsqueda de ver cómo mantener su hogar y luego de que se mudara de vivienda, decidió abrir un pequeño negocio de preparar y vender desayunos en su propia casa. En la actualidad, ella sirve desayunos y a veces también almuerzos si es que sus clientes se lo piden. A sus 63 años ella aún continua con las mismas ganas de seguir en su negocio como al inicio. Junto con su nuera, ella desea ver crecer su restaurante. Su objetivo a largo plazo es poder remodelarlo. Sin embargo, lo que más anhela es comprar estantes donde ella pueda mostrar sus platos y bebidas y también, comprar nuevas mesas y sillas para sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase shelves and new furniture for her restaurant

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Olegaria

texts.es:
I have had my hairstyling business for over 6 years. I mainly offer my services at my clients' homes because I have not been to properly set up my salon. The reason why I am asking for a $500 loan is to be able to make some improvements to my salon so I can take care of my clients. This business is my family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 6 años con mi negocio de estilista. Mas que nada en el negocio hago servicios a domicilio porque todavía no tengo bien acondicionado el loca. Es el motivo por el cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls. Para mejorar el local y así atender a mis clientes. Ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia.

loans.use: To make improvements to hair salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
For Constantina it all started with the idea of getting ahead and to bring in an income that would help her family. So she rented a market stand/space in her neighborhood and began selling wool and threads. Gradually with the desire to grow her business, she began selling more products. With her hard work, Constantina still runs her business today and it's improving all the time. For 9 years now, she sells wool, yarns, clothing for infants and handbags that she makes herself. To complement her business, in addition to selling, also offers instruction in fabrics and wool and in making handbags. In the future, she would like to have a bigger space and to be able to export the goods she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Para Constantina todo inició con la idea de progresar y tener un ingreso que ayudara en su familia. Es así que alquilo un puesto en el mercado de su barrio y empezó a vender lanas e hilos. Poco a poco con las ganas de crecer, fue surtiendo su tienda con más productos Con todo su esfuerzo, hoy en día, Constantina mantiene aún su negocio en pie y con más mejoras cada vez. Desde hace 9 años ella vende lana, hilos, ropa para bebes y carteras que ella misma elabora. Para complementar su negocio, además de vender, también ofrece el servicio de enseñanza en el tejido con lanas y elaboración de carteras. En un futuro, ella quisiera tener un puesto más grande que en la actualidad y poder exportar los productos que ella elabora.

loans.use: To move to a larger space where she can run her business.  (Mudarse a una tienda de mercado más grande que el actual)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
For over 16 years I've been earning a living selling new and second-hand clothing in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. My wife and I work the business, which is our family's source of income. We now wish to invest in the purchase of more new clothes and shoes. We ask for a loan of $1,200.00 to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 16 años que me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Pero queremos invertirle mas al negocio de ropa nueva y zapatos, solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Rayo

texts.es:
Ms. F. has owned her small grocery store for over two years. This business is her family's source of income. She currently needs to purchase more merchandise and to make some improvements to her store so that she can sell dairy products and cold cuts.
