La señora Camila es una comerciante de mucha experiencia en ventas de ropa para dama y caballeros, cosméticos y electrodomésticos para el hogar, negocio que lo desarrollo en su vivienda y el cual ha ido expandiéndose, ya que ofrece una gran variedad de productos, estilos, marcas y precios.

Tiene un buen número de clientas que le compran y le encargan, le dedica todo el día a su negocio. Los productos que comercializa los compra en el mercado central a precios favorables debido a que compra en grandes volúmenes. Inicio su negocio hace 14 años con la venta de ropa y cosméticos únicamente, hoy lo tiene más amplio, esto es debido a su buena administración, ya que el mismo negocio le ha permitido profesionalizar a sus tres hijas, las cuales viven independientes de ella.

La señora en estos momentos necesita un préstamo para comprar electrodomésticos que le han encargado sus clientas como son TV, RADIO, DVD entre otras cosas. Los clientes tienen la facilidad de adquirir los electrodomésticos al crédito con facilidades de pago semanal, quincenal o mensual.

loans.use: To purchase appliances to invest in her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de la Concepción is an enterprising woman who started her business five years ago in her humble home. She makes tortillas stuffed with cheese, chicken, and beans; pinolillo (a traditional beverage); and corn tortillas. She makes all of these products by hand. She started her business due to the need to take care of her daughter, since she is a single mother and doesn't have economic support from any family member. She has been able to get ahead and to offer her daughter what is most important: an education.

Maria's dream is to see her daughter become a professional. Right now, María needs to build a concrete wall behind their home. Right now there is one made of pieces of wood, which doesn't offer any protection to her family. María's plans are to construct a kiosk in her house where her clients can sample the food that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria de la Concepción es una mujer emprendedora que hace 5 años logro poner su negocio en su humilde vivienda, el cual consiste en elaborar pupusas de queso, pollo y frijoles, pinolillo (bebida típica), tortillas de maiz. Todos estos roductos son elaborados con sus propias manos. El negocio surge debido a la necesidad de la señora de sacar adelante a su hija, ya que es madre soltera y no cuenta con el apoyo económico de ningún familiar. Ha podido salir adelante y brindarle a su hija lo que para ella es lo más importante: la educación.

Su sueño es poder ver a su hija convertida en una profesional: en estos momentos Maria necesita construir un muro de concreto para la parte de atrás de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra hecho de pedazos de madera, y no le brinda ninguna protección a su familia. Los planes de Maria es construir un Kiosko en su casa de habitación en donde sus clientes puedan degustar las comidas que ella elabora

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, and sand to construct a wall

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ethel Johana

texts.es:
Señora Ethel is a single mother of three small children. Two years ago she decided to begin her small business in her humble dwelling, located in the Laureles Norte Neighborhood, due to the lack of economic support from the father of her children. She decided to open a shop for toothpaste, toilet paper, milk, caramels, bread, etc. that in Nicaragua they call a pulpería. She began this micro business with her own resources and it has continued growing little by little with financing from AFODENIC.

The people of her community have few economic resources, just like her, and every morning they buy their breakfast for that day according to their means. Ethel works at the business seven days a week from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. She requests the loan to expand the space in her house where she has this small business, and thus to be able to sell more products since at this time her customers are demanding new products. She does not have any place to put them due to the small space. Enlarging her shop will give her more income to supply the needs of her children, in consideration of the fact that this is their only source of support.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ethel es madre soltera de tres hijos pequeños, desde hace 2 años decidió montar su pequeño negocio en su humilde vivienda, ubicado en el Barrio Laureles Norte, debido a la falta de apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos decide abrir una ventecita de pasta de diente, papel higiénico, leche, caramelos, pan , etc. que en Nicaragua le llamamos pulpería, empezó este micro negocio con recursos propios el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco con financiamiento de AFODENIC.

La población de su comunidad son de escasos recursos económicos al igual que ella y compran todas las mañanas el desayuno de ese día según sus posibilidades. La señora se dedica al negocio, los siete días de la semana desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 p.m.La señora solicita el préstamo para ampliar el espacio que en su casa esta su pequeño negocio, y así poder colocar a la venta mas productos ya que en estos momentos le están demandando nuevos productos que ella no tiene donde colocarlos debido al pequeño espacio y el hacer un poco mas grande su venta le dara mas ingresos para suplir las necesidades de sus hijos en vista que esta es su única fuente de entrada.

loans.use: To enlarge the size of her shop so that she can offer more items for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
For 4 years now, Carlos has been peddling tickets for a lottery named ‘raspaditas’ and other lotteries in the most frequented streets of Managua, markets, banks and malls. He begins selling at 7:00 a.m. and travels through the streets all day in search of people who like to try their luck and that are fans of the lotteries named ‘raspaditas’ and ‘chalupa’. The income generated by this activity is very varied. This line of work is very hard, since he runs many risks such as being mugged, and he does not have a set locale where he can sell his product. He does all this due to having 2 small children to maintain and support. This is his only option for work at the moment. However, his hindrance is his inability to purchase all the lottery numbers and offer variety to his clients. This is why he requests a loan to buy lottery tickets ending in the numbers zero through nine and not pass up customers or sales, and to increase his income which is what he maintains his family with.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Carlos desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender de manera ambulante una lotería llamada raspaditas y billetes de loterías en las calles más transitadas de Managua, mercados, bancos y centros comerciales, su venta inicia a las 7: 00 a.m., todo el día recorre las calles en busca de personas que les gusta probar suerte y que sean fanáticos de comprar loterías, raspaditas y chalupa. Los ingresos generados por esta actividad son muy variados. Este tipo de trabajo es muy duro, ya que corre muchos riesgos como que lo asalten, él no cuenta con un lugar fijo en el que pueda vender su producto. Todo esto lo realiza debido a que tiene 2 hijos pequeños a quien mantener y sacar adelante, esta es la única opción de trabajo con la que cuenta en estos momentos. Sin embargo su limitante es que no tiene capacidad para comprar todos los números de loterías y tener variedad para sus clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar números de loterías del cero al nueve y no dejar ir clientes, ventas y aumentar sus ingresos que es con lo que mantiene a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
"I'm divorced and have 1 adolescent daughter. I manage to make some improvements in my home with my job and the alimony that my ex-husband gives me but it is still difficult. Currently, I'd like to build a room and a bathroom on the second floor of my home for more space. I seek a loan of $1200 to build a room and a bath in the second floor of my home. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. “Yo soy divorciada y tengo1hija adolescente, con mi trabajo y la pensión que me da mi ex esposo he logrado hacerle algunas mejoras a mi vivienda pero es difícil, ahora me gustaría hacer un cuarto y un baño el la planta alta de mi casa para tener un poco más de espacio. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir un cuarto y un baño en planta alta de mi vivienda."

loans.use: to build a room and bathroom

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es:
” The floor in my home is made of cement and is difficult to keep clean. I would like to put tiled floor mostly for my children since it accumulates too much dust, and it is unhygienic for them. I have wanted to put it for a very long time, but in reality, there were other priorities also related to home improvement.” I am requesting $1,000.00 to put tiled floor in my home.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

““El piso de mi vivienda es de cemento y es difícil mantenerlo limpio, me gustaría poner vitropiso más que nada por mis hijos ya que se acumula mucha tierra y es antigénico para ellos desde hace mucho que he tenido la intención de ponerlo pero en realidad tenia otras prioridades también relacionadas con el mejoramiento de mi vivienda” Solicito  $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner vitropiso en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install tiled floor in my home.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
” I have some construction that is unfinished due to lack of funds. I stopped the project a few months ago, and now I would like to lay paving stone in those rooms so we can inhabit them. Recently, with some savings, I put the front gate to make my home more secure, but my family needs to expand the house a bit so we decided to finish these rooms.” I am requesting $1,000.00 to lay paving stone in two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

““Tengo una construcción sin terminar ya que me falto dinero, hace varios meses que detuve la obra y ahora me gustaría poner la losa de concreto en esos cuartos para poder habitarlos, hace poco con algunos ahorros puse el portón de enfrente para darle más seguridad a mi vivienda, pero mi familia requiere de ampliar un poco la casa así es que decidimos terminar los cuartos ” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner la losa de concreto en dos cuartos.

loans.use: Lay paving stone in two rooms

loans.name: Mohammad Aziz

texts.en:
Mohammad Aziz lives with his nuclear family in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has a shop where he sells bottled gas. He has been involved in this business for more than two years. During these two years, his business has been growing slowly.

Now he wants to expand his business even more by taking an individual loan to complete his stock and attract more clients so that he can make a good income. He is happy with the process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Parwiaz

texts.en:
Parwiaz lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is an educated man. He was in the army where he was a pilot but during the war in Afghanistan he was injured. Then he left the army and started up a business, opening a retail shop that he is still running now.

Parwiaz would like to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock so that he can make a good income and help his family. He happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia lives with her own nuclear family in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widow and has 4 children. Her husband died in a explosion last year in Kabul, but she is managing to support her family by working as a tailor. She has good experience in sewing traditional Afghani clothes in Kabul and selling what she sews to shopkeepers in the bazaar.

Razia needs to expand her business so she wants to take an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and complete her necessary business materials. This will allow her to make a good income and better support her family. She is happy with all the members of her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Mohammad Reza

texts.en: Mohammad Reza lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his nuclear family and has a carpentry shop. He has good experience in carpentry. He has been working at this trade since he was small boy. He opened a carpentry shop where he works independently, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good monthly income to support his family. He is happy that he can further his business in this way.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Wahidallah

texts.en: Wahidallah lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He was still a young boy when his father died. He is supporting his mother while he is still in school, working part-time in his photocopy shop. He is requesting an individual loan to buy a new photocopy machine and also to complete other necessary business materials so that he can make a good income to help his mother and also make a better future for himself. He is happy to be able to further his business.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopy machine
